8HEA-WNiA5XXALhhfxNBBg.text: Hey if the pizza isn't greasy, it's not NY pizza!!!  We discovered this GEM about a year ago and have referred so many people here that are from New York City, Queens, Brooklyn, Long Island even up state and the result is always the same, it's delicious. :) We started with a regular slice of pizza, then got hooked on the Grandma for a while, and ventured into the dinners, the Stromboli's are delicious, my favorite is the chicken parmigiana one, we do however like the previous version of the garlic knots, they changed and eh- the other ones were bigger and a lot more flavor-able.  We really enjoyed the baked ziti, the ravioli, spaghetti with garlic and oil, and my husband likes the hero sandwiches and the bread is delicious, so my review is hurry up and go!  The 2 pizza and a drink special is great too.... Oh let's not forget the cannoli I feel like I am in New York all over again. We absolutely adore all the staff, very personable, kind and their main focus is to see that you enjoy what you have ordered.  Try it, you'll love it, and if you don't, try it again because something went wrong....

HFZYFaa_5iwHhN-RK7wNPg.text: Friend brought me here for lunch special and to try their pizza.   The price for 2 pieces and a drink is a really great deal and the pizza slices are huge.  Staff is friendly.  I got 2 cheese slices which are thin crust which i thought was cooked to the right texture. Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because my slices were a bit on the greasy side. I soaked up 1 1/2 napkins each slice.   Other than that,  great place to grab a quick lunch for a great price ! Definitely fits a college student's budget :)

FzwJGnsM753DOTVAudAdqQ.text: As a native New Yorker, actually from the Bronx, the search for a good slice became like searching for the holy grail. Bambinos is the best. Perfect crispness of the crust, the cheese and oil ratio great and the white pizza is to die for!!

YSF307QvD_5smVNlqGap0A.text: I decided to check this place out when that sudden craving for pizza hit. Based on the reviews I figured it was good. It was not good. It was flippin' amazing! Giant slices for a great price. I got two slices of pepperoni and two garlic knots for $6 and some change. The staff was amazingly warm and friendly. Really made you feel like this was "your" pizza place even when it's your first time in. I will definitely be returning and probably soon!

_iti-55aH9qIr5Ymsvnh2w.text: Talk about finding a great hole in the wall kind of place!  I stumbled upon this little gem while looking for a place to eat on a Sunday afternoon. It's a little joint that is clearly family owned and simple.   When we walked in, they had this great welcoming attitude. The whole family was friendly and willing to explain the details on how to place an order which was very helpful.   We got done ordering and the food was just incredible! The portions were HUGE for its cheap and affordable price. The ingredients were all fresh and made in house! The flavors blends nicely with each other and the plating was just very simple which is good. I love the fact that they kept the parmesan in the fridge to keep it fresh and they got all the spices on each of the table. After the meal was done they were very courteous and even offered if i wanted to try the garlic knots which were not bad as well.   Another point that i found really great was that they kept their bathroom clean and smelling fresh!   Will definitely go back and try the wood fired pizza next time! Let's support this small local business!

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White pizza with bacon mushroom and home made sausage!

GFKOEqTKfoa-els_v05TOw.text: Absolutely astonished with this place! The food was incredible, and very well priced. Staff was very generous and helpful with my questions. The pizza is excellent no matter the type, or toppings you decide to throw onto it. The family at Bambinos came from New York, and you can really tell! I'm from New York myself, and even THERE it's hard to match what the owner produces. I've also read some other reviews on here which were completely False! When I mentioned prices being well, I meant it! Someone was claiming that pizza and wings was over 50$ which is outrageous and False! People also said that there are no specials, which is why I ask this one question: Have you even been to this restaurant? There's always specials available for pizza and chicken! I've rambled on enough here folks, now it's up to you to decide, and eat some of this fine food for yourselves. I know one thing, my family and I will be visiting this place weekly from here on! P.S. : Don't always listen to the negatives, especially when there's very little. Some people just get upset because they have nothing better to do but cause waves of negativity. Be open minded, and if you're in the area, YOU be the judge.

4b5LSl9rut8iSa6nx-DoVg.text: Just found this place randomly.  Wicked awesome that they have Boston memorabilia all over ... what a hoot!  I felt like I was at home.  We have only ordered the meatball subs and the service and food were terrific.  Looking forward to taking the folks when they come out to visit.  Will try more of their menu soon.

nXRW1rAErSzUpt09m5XmBA.text: I had heard that this place was new and had great NY pizza.  Since I live only a few blocks away, I called for delivery.  I ordered a margarita pizza and the employee recommended the "Grandma" which I accepted.  It arrived promptly and was very good but I was surprised that the pizza was square, not round and thin crust like a real NY pizza. No problem - it was delicious. Well, tonight I called them and asked if all of their pizzas were square. No, just the Grandma and 1 other. Ok. May I please order some food for delivery? No, it's too late.  It was exactly 9:12 pm on a Sat night. I said I didn't care how long it took and I was very close. No go. I said that Villa Pizza down the street delivers until 10:30 so he rudely told me to call Villa. With that kind of attitude, I will never order there again! Considering that I spend $100 a week on pizza delivery and tip 35 % or more to the drivers, it's their lost. Never again!

2MfAirm8t9vbVUZiWYnP3g.text: ordered for dilivery.....medium meat lovers with mushrooms which they forgot to put on my pizza....didnt bother calling back because i was hungry and didnt feel like waiting for  them to correct my order......what is the policy for messing up orders anyway?

JIORb7xN7kltNM8jFHVdkQ.text: Ever since moving to sin city I've been trying to find a local pizza place with great thin crust pizza and that home town feel. I really thought this would be the place to go after reading other reviews, but I was disappointed.  My boyfriend and I ordered a good old pepperoni pizza and some zucchini sticks for take out. The whole ordering process was pretty easy and the order was ready when we came to pick it up. Then comes the disappointing part.   The pizza was soggy and super greasy. I couldn't even pick a piece up without the toppings falling off and the crust was the only crispy part about it. The zucchini sticks were probable the best part but the sauce was spilled upside down in the bag therefore making it quite messy to eat. You would think they would check the presentation of things before just sending it out to customers.  I guess my search for good local pizza continues.

dxKfHswfx3GtqSSOQJplAA.text: Pizza was ok. To be honest was expecting a little more. Got the white pizza. They give huge slices. Maybe I just prefer my pizza freshly made rather than reheated. But if you buy by the slice it's pretty affordable. And the setting is pretty intimate since it's not a huge place.

kNTWGpVGzJTL-69T3hjUiA.text: I have been coming to Bambino's for a few years now. USED to be far and away the best place for NY style pizza/italian in LV. Recently, while the service is always fantastic, the quality of the food has gone downhill. The pizza in the display case looks old, and for some reason to counteract this there is now a sign stating at what time the each pizza was made. They are noticeably smaller than they used to be, and taste as though a couple of small corners are being cut to save money. The icing on the cake for me was last week when I ordered a chicken stromboli, which I have probably eaten at least once a week for the past two years. While it arrived and looked huge on the outside, inside there was at most two small strips of chicken. This dish used to be awesome filled to the brim with quality breaded pieces of chicken. However, besides being skimpy, the meat was heavily breaded and just felt much lower quality than in the past. To add insult to injury, the side dish of tomato sauce that was served was ICE cold straight from the refrigerator. This tells me that quality is being overlooked. Now, is it possible that this was just an off night? Of course, but the past few times my family and I have gone in it seems things have taken a small step in the wrong direction, even leading us to walk out a couple of weeks ago. I really really used to love Bambino's and want to remain a loyal visitor. However, it is not hard to tell when something is not quite right with a restaurant and perhaps corners are being cut to make it work. Hopefully whatever has sidetracked these guys can be straightened out quickly to return this place to its former perch atop the pizza pedestal.

6jpZ7XsmKErl3Yh3Vcm25A.text: I gave this rating based on finding a long peice of hair in my ceasar salad. The pizza, Grandma's Pizza was amazing.

One thing it had a lot of was crust, in fact I can't remember a pizza where I ended up with such a huge crust that went completely to waste. Not up to the competition unfortunately...

rzKi8M1g-cUOzdt7v-Mb5w.text: I've been to Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria four times now and have enjoyed each visit. I like their very flavorful cheese slices and the special is a real deal. Last visit I added  Italian sausage and really liked that too. My wife enjoyed their Caesar salad with grilled chicken and some of my friends have tried the pasta and been pleased. The service has usually been good and the atmosphere is typical strip mall storefront ambience but it is clean and nicely decorated. Worth a look for lunch or a casual dinner.

Ocs2IUJl5k0BwAhhM2DP0g.text: Wow this place is awesome!! I went there tonight got 2 giant slices cheese with soda combo.  It's authentic New York pie.  This is a must go.  Nothing like a NY slice!!

VWP9D3Cy459gV_C5TCmFWw.text: I love Bambino's. It is within walking distance from my place and they have a great $16 special-lg cheese pizza and wings.   It's not world's greatest pizza ever but it definitely gets the job done.Check them out.

YjiVH8jBmQRK0JPPKD7AbA.text: Wow!- that was a good pie our family just ate. The pizza was tasty and done just right. I grew up in New Jersey about an hour from NYC - yes I grew up eating pizza that was good. I've lived here almost 25 years now and this is just like back home. My first time eating here tonight - I'll definitely be back! Nice job guys!

MzrOp75c5lrkvNoPHd9n4Q.text: I feel I have to start with a disclaimer. My sister is a waitress here but that didn't influence my opinion of the food. This was my first time eating at Bambino's and I know I'll be back as often as I can. I started with an order of chicken wings (plain) with ranch dressing on the side. They are among the best wings I've ever eaten. I'm not sure what they do to them but they're crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside -- just the way a wing ought to be. The ranch dressing is made in-house and, again, is some of the best I've had. There's a major difference in taste between homemade and the dressings some places buy in bulk and serve on their salads and with their wings. I also ordered a medium sausage pizza. I know some people think it's a minus when the pizza comes out of the kitchen with that little pool of grease on top and they grab napkins and mop it up. Nope, that's the sign of a tasty pizza! The crust is crispy yet soft enough to fold for that NY method of eating pizza. The toppings are generous and, judging by the taste, seem to be top quality. I took more than half of the pizza home and can tell you that it even tastes good reheated in the oven. I can't wait to go back for more of those wings!

6pSliU6WceXuQfmWgHXALg.text: I travel to different citys on my job an i got to say the sauce is great! pizza is awsome! service with a smile! all a good combination! i recommend this real east coast pizzeria!

BYh_tJVKtCEic1aUk7iLHQ.text: This review is for the current Bambino's, they have managed this location for maybe 4 months now. The pizza is NOTHING like the original owners. Oily, average crust, uninspired pizza sauce, you get the picture.Will not order from them again. They ran one of the best pizzas name into the ground, to save a few bucks, i guess.

P0BZkH8vevMZE4HdCQhpXQ.text: Best pizza in Las Vegas. NO QUESTION. Living in Boston and being the daughter of Italian chef, I would eat pizza about twice a week before I moved to Las Vegas. I love pizza. I love everything about it. When I moved to Las Vegas about 10 months ago, one of my first missions was to find a local pizza place. Well let me tell you... this is NO JOKE or exaggeration.. i ate pizza every day for about 2-3 weeks, trying all different places in the Las Vegas Valley. (Even tried some in California) There is no debate: West Coat just does not make pizza like east coast. All you West Coasters will beg to differ, but that's because you have nothing to compare it to.  Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria is by FAR the best pizza in Las Vegas. Those who claim the pizza is "too greasy" obviously have never eaten at an authentic pizza joint on the east coast. I actually found it funny when people comment about the grease.. that's actually how i knew i needed to try this place!  The pizza was perfect.. sooooo cheesy it just ooozed and would come out in long strings whenever i bit into it! man i havent found anywhere in vegas like this yet!  Trust an opinion from me, an Italian chef's daughter who grew up in Boston for 27 years.. this is THE ONLY PLACE TO GO FOR PIZZA IF YOU ARE FROM THE EAST COAST

G1Tz-A7CYiu9H5X7oIhOtA.text: Just stopped in by chance on the way to a friends house,  first time in 19 years that I've had east coast style pizza.   Awesome surprise,  great service, good price,  2 slices and a drink $5, well worth it. Brought back memories of growing up back east.  Most pizza here is like cardboard with Ragu, keep up the good work, I'll definitely be going back.

T2VMUFmVjNfpMPq6PYt0zw.text: Just tried Grandma's Pizza, amazing! Not sure if I want any other kind of pie.

E72_h4dCq9wcORAzmepHww.text: Ordered a large cheese pie crisp to be picked up. When I arrived they were pretty busy for a Friday. I had to wait a short while and thought my pie was just being removed from the oven. Looking at it I was a little disappointed that it did not look like What I requested. Well, it wasn't my order and the next pie up was. It was prepared just the way I like it. Everyone was friendly and smiling while they were working. The close for me was the guy making the pizza wearing a white "t" shirt. Not only was it great watching a great pizza being tossed but thanks for the back east memory. Pie was delicious.

smRm0_HXJm_ys2Qx9TlEsg.text: As good as it gets for pizza in Vegas. Order your pie well done(a must!) and enjoy every single bite. All of the food here is excellent, so try a few things and you won't be disappointed.

MdYaOJAd8y3zbk3uFBIsEQ.text: Love this place!  Fantastic pizza (cheese & meat~lovers), wings & garlic knots.  Family owned, great baseball decor, nice place to watch sports or quick delivery to my place.

Ubi8liPzeHulGCAjE31rjA.text: No frills. Nothing fancy. Just absolutely delicious Italian food and very reasonable prices. Definitely not low carb: garlic bread knots with dipping sauce, veal sandwiches, meatballs on the side. Outstanding!

Dv5XsMYb0xanlGE1pJO1Jg.text: Customer service : I was not greeted when I walked in and there were two people standing there. One made direct eye contact with me and said nothing. The other woman said hello after I stared at the menu for a bit and asked me what she could get for me. I said I was not sure so she just walked away.   Food: I ordered the number two lunch special which is a slice of cheese pizza, a salad and a fountain drink for 6 dollars. The sauce on the pizza was too sweet for my liking and the dough was too soggy. The salad was good, it was just lettuce, cherry tomatoes and carrots with a balsamic vinaigrette.

5bEWRQ8X2YsQPTiX8IGZ1g.text: Part of my Pizza Bender 2011 Edition, I stopped by this place and decided to give their 2 Slice special a try.  2 Slices of Cheese Pizza & a fountain drink for $5.....pretty good deal.  I added Sausage & Pepperoni for an additional $1 ($.50 per topping).  The joint is decked out in Boston photos and memorabilia.....be prepared to get a talking to if you walk in here with other sports teams gear.  A guy with a Lakers hat was catching some guff from the owner.  It was all in good fun and they were both having fun talking a bit of trash about the other team.  Hilarious.  After a few minutes my Pizza came out.  It's a thin Crust variety, very similar to NY Style.  I'm not calling it NY Style because it's a Boston Pizza joint.  The slices are pretty big and you have to fold it if you want to eat it with your hands.....I like it better that way.  The Pizza was pretty good....above average.  I thought the Sausage was much better than the Pepperoni.  The Pepperoni wasn't anything special.  The Cheese was gooey and had good flavor.  I didn't have to add anything to the Pizza, I enjoyed it as is.  Overall, It's a pretty good Pizza.  If I could, I'd give it 3.75 Stars, but I'm rounding up here.  Return Factor - 60%....would be higher if I lived nearby.

Fr-4OJBypt9Yo5J3cVqZDQ.text: THE BEST New York style pizza in town. PERIOD. The rice balls are great, the conolis are to die for. Don't waste your time and money going elsewhere if you're looking for New York style pizza. They make delicious calzones, and their other pasta dishes are out of this world. The people who own this joint are old school. You're going to love this place. Casual Pizzeria style atmosphere.

w4kYRH5K5P5DDEsnyueMug.text: John and the crew are great! I always feel welcome and the pizza is amazing. (True New York style pizza) Great food!

1NtQ95YaaLGf1RYzclZDwg.text: The owner and employees are very kind and attentive! The food was absolutely delicious and the price is very reasonable! I love this place very much. I recommend trying the mussels with red suave, grandma pizza, and the Alfredo. Amazing! 5 stars.

1EeZtfjz4o9gvNn6EcBPDA.text: Great place to grab a slice or I would highly recommend a sub sandwhich.   They have great pricing for how good the food is.   The owners have become friends of ours.  Since we use to frequent the place atleast twice a week when we lived near there.

KJX9PfXJuJ71FBPXGwZ7-Q.text: Love the pizza, even the crust is amazing! Caprese salad was tasty and fresh. Buffalo wings are the best I've had. Definitely one of our favorite pizza places!

pVmScrwdkTzH-BsvTyxlfw.text: After Church this Sunday, we came with some friends for lunch.  We ordered the Chiken, Shrimp and Meatball sandwiches...simply perfection! Crunchy bread, delicious red sauce,  plenty of mozzarella melted over the meats... I have never had better.

9UiJDctDtzPUlFeCdCswEg.text: Good crust and that makes for a solid NY style slice. The 2 slices deal is awesome. Not a long wait and the restaurant is very clean inside. Will return!

wgsVT_J1WrJ3JMgV0ej7zg.text: When think you try it all and then you find better place. Love the place. Quick service. Great cheese. Recommend aaa

Wv2SMNGKwh7UkUBZJkfSyA.text: I had the cheese pizza and zeppole, both were very good. The service was friendly, but not fantastic. Definitely worth the time to visit.

4h1Ckru8iOvTbAUUphQ8Bw.text: Just when I thought Bambino's couldn't get any better it did! There are new owners now from Long Island (where I happen to be from!) and they have knocked this place out of the park. Seriously, it is as good as any NY pizzeria. They know what they are doing - work hard and even carry out your pie for you. This family owned pizzeria is the best. Go in on any Friday night and you will know how good. You would think you were in NY with all the NY accents. Nyers don't go just anywhere. They are flocking here now! Give it a try!

egaR0_7USnJ2l2GKrYTQ2w.text: Best pizza in the SW and one of the best in the whole city ! Nice people and authentic flavors.

tAx9rF-fK-qrvX94twaJaA.text: Use to order pizza from here all the time. Haven't in a few months so we decided to order from Postmates and ordered the Grandma's. The minute I opened the box I knew it wasn't going to be like I remembered. Barely finished one slice.

AAyMmXo7AXqb0Um9BcvN4Q.text: First time here. We've tried a lot of pizza but East Coast was our first. The place is cozy, not a large dine in area, but it seems, their take out is a big part of the business.   We saw calamari at the next table and it looked good so we started with that. Golden, crispy, seasoned well. The marinara sauce was sweet, rich and chunky.  Next a plate of spaghetti with marinara meat sauce. Again a rich, hearty meat sauce.   Finally a 14 inch pizza, we selected meatballs, pepperoni, mushrooms and extra cheese. It was delicious.   Good service, they're busy at dinner time! Good prices, parking is weird, especially with all the people coming to pick up. We will be back.

d7KF6imU-_ILRMd-FdsbOg.text: My cousin and I came to Bambinos after a strenuous hike out at Red Rock. We worked up a serious appetite and yelped the yummiest mom and pop pizza joint near us. Bambinos caught our eye so we set out for our highly anticipated pie. It was easy to find tucked into a shopping strip of sorts. We were greeted immediately and handed menus at the counter that you order at. We decided on a Cesar salad and a large grandmas pie. We sat down and the waitress brought markers out for my daughter. As a momma, I always appreciate kind gestures like these.   Our small Cesar salad came out quickly and we were both happy with the size of it. (A small is large enough for two people to split) They brought out a  warm loaf of French bread shortly after. I indulged and grabbed a bottle of olive oil from the condiment/ utensil hutch and made a nice mixture of olive oil, Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. We dipped our warm French bread in the olive oil and it was heavenly.  **What? We earned it on our hike, remember??? **  As we were finishing off our salad, the pie came out! Perfect timing! The crust was the perfect combination of crunchy yet doughey. With each bite there was crispy crunch, but you still have to pull a bit to tear the bread. (This is my favorite type of crust y'all) The cheese used for this pizza HAS to be some kind of specialty or imported cheese because it was so tasty. Lastly the sauce. A pizza is nothing with out sauce and I'll be the first to say their sauce was magnificent.   Needless to say, We ate way to much. What we had left over we decided to bring to my husbands office so that  we could share the deliciousness we had just experienced. (It would have been horribly selfish to have kept it all for myself- although I deeply considered it.)   Walking through his office felt like the cha cha train you'd do at a wedding. With every turn we had more of my husbands colleagues behind us following the incredible aroma of the pizza. By the time I got to my husbands office- most of his co workers were popping in asking where the pizza came from! Don't worry, I encouraged him to share.   The ONLY thing I saw that I didn't LOVE, was the table next to us ordered a big beautiful pepperoni pizza. When it came out I was drooling over the smell. I personally don't eat meat so that should tell YOU something. The gentleman that ordered the pie called over my attention as he preformed an almost professional cheese pull. It was glorious. BUT than came the grease. SO MUCH GREASE. There was a puddle under the slice. That was concerning but I asked him how it tasted? He raved about how yummy his slice was while the rest of his table continued to moan with each bite. So I made the assumption that the grease didn't effect the integrity of the crust.   Anyways- we can't wait to go back. Would love to see an arugula option for on top of the grandma pie!  It was absolutely delicious. We had a great time, wonderful service, quality ingredients, and speedy service. Great mom and pop joint!

HztgoxDyqfxcPWL6B6DG7w.text: I wish I could give this place 10 stars! We eat here just about every Sunday! Our girls can make their own pizza for $4. We just came down from Texas & my husband is from New York & this pizza is the best we found outside of New York. The wings are the best I've ever had anywhere. Despite the incredible food, the service is probably our favorite thing about this place. We love Rosie!

lQhD0mGeIZYEXMYfoJJYjw.text: 4 1/2 stars. I'd been craving white pizza since I arrived to Las  Vegas so seeing Bambino's caught my eye. Located on the west side of Vegas it's a short drive to the small but popular eatery.  I called my order in and advised them when I would be arriving.  Once arriving and not having any issue parking, we wewre seared at a table by the friendly male employees and started us with the half order of antipasto salad and put white pizza in the oven. The salad was large and had the whole kitchen of ingredients that made the salad outstanding . Timing was perfect of receiving the pizza which was rich tasting and delicious.   I definitely was satisfied and got my white pizza fix at Bambino's!

26zblXpBQ5JO9io7m-EOCw.text: The inside of this place was very clean and nice, ordered a sausage and pepperoni pizza and it was excellent!

RRN1F-0gT2IBCSV4Nx7CTQ.text: This place was surprisingly pretty good. From the outside it doesn't look like it's gonna be that great it's a little run down but don't let that fool you. They had a special, a large cheese pizza (you can add toppings) and 10 wings for $20. We got that and some garlic knots for $3. The prices are great and you get a lot of food. There was four of us and still took home 4 slices. The wings were bomb had just the right amount of crisp the garlic knots were really good too. The pizza was also really good not over cooked or anything and just the right amount of crust. The ranch was the good ranch so that was a plus. Would definitely recommend and will be returning.

T2nxBtGRBb1xNVo1vHuf0A.text: Absolutely love this place. Been a regular since I moved into the neighborhood. Stellar customer service and even better pies. Wings are AMAZING too. Brought 40 to a Super Bowl party this weekend. I didn't place an order in advance...but the wait wasn't long at all. To be honest, I wish I had to wait a bit longer to eat a couple more slices (best Grandma and Sicilian I've had).

6zZd7KdI6YBaiEq4tYv86Q.text: Soooo good! Best pizza I have had so far in the Vegas/Summerlin area. Got the pepperoni pizza to be safe and it Tasted very authentic. Great service as well!

W9g-WMisYcS7GQ8BL7QTKg.text: My friends and I go there frequently and we are never disappointed.  Quality ever time. Salad and pasta portions are huge.  Highly recommend the pizza as well.  Lisa is an  excellent server. C. Heinrich

chahD-M0pGH9-A87mhJ-Bw.text: Monday, June 20th 2016 @ 7:30 PM.  This is definitely an East Coast pizzeria to the fullest.  I ordered a 18" (Large) pepperoni pizza.  I didn't hold out much hope since we've been let down a few times.  The gentlemen that picked up said it would take 25 minutes,  "no problem" I said.  This place had maybe 7 tables inside & two Televisions. There was 10 people total sitting in the dining area. A couple,  table of 4, two guys & another pick up order.   Staff was busy serving pizzas left & right.  I watched as they served the tables & it smelled anazing.  Our order want ready for another 8 minutes which I'm cool with as long as it's good pizza. Total came to $18.12.  The ride home seemed like forever & when we got home all 3 of us said it was the best greasy pizza ever out here.  Being from Rhode Island we all miss the pizza, this hit the spot.  We'll be back since we know all demolished this order.  I normally post pictures but I didn't have a chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deliciously gone.  I like garlic powder and parmesan on my slice. Bambino&#39;s East Coast pizzeria is the best.

8a25q0kNRLybWGpPcD1dOA.text: Off the charts !  Had fried zucchini, mozzarella sticks, garlic knots, wings, and Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken. Everything was SO GOOD !! Service was great. This is going to be my new place. Did i mention I'm Italian?

jbZnUQIkTB7jrahCwT-Glg.text: Gluten free option for all the Keto diets out there. Very sharp people running this place it was packed during lunch hour on a Wednesday with good specials and a very attentive staff. Check them out if you are in the area.

GdLd8Sen9hoS0iCS7SCALg.text: This was a solid A-OK experience.   My man friend's poppa was in town and is a big fan of Sicilian style pizza. Heard great things via many of my Yelp friend's reviews about this place so I made the drive across town. Don't let my 3-stars fool you into thinking this wasn't a good experience. It was good, just not great.   They were super busy at the counter when I walked in so I snagged a table in the back corner near the window. The young gentleman taking our order was new and a bit nervous. We ordered the Sicilian and added pepperoni as well as the Antipasto salad. The poor kid seemed really unsure when he walked away with our order. Our salad came and it was pretty tasty. Loaded with meats, cheeses, and olives - it was plenty for three of us to share as a starter. We opted for the Italian dressing and I was a fan. Next thing you know a large round pepperoni pizza shows up at our table. It looked delicious but it's not what we ordered.  Unfortunately, he thought we had ordered two pizzas. One large pepperoni and one Sicilian as is. I watched with sadness as the pepperoni pizza was taken back to the kitchen. Another gal came over to verify that we only wanted one pizza - Sicilian with pepperoni - and to apologize because the other employee was new. It was an honest mistake and it was all fine. The Sicilian pizza came out soon after and the crust was perfectly crispy and buttery. Super cheesy and the sauce was quite good. Not as sweet as other Sicilian style pizzas I've had, but a solid 4-stars.Unfortunately, the pepperoni was added last minute due to the ordering snafu so it wasn't crispy at all, but that's okay!  I will definitely be visiting this place again because the staff was super nice and the food was great. They did start closing 30 minutes early so I felt a bit rushed to get out once they started putting the chairs on the tables but the experience overall was very pleasant. I mean, it's pizza! And pizza is always a good time.

GarKBRAIheH0SUJvHyH8DQ.text: Possibly the absolute worst pizza we have had in the last five years.  I agree that Bambino's at one time was an excellent pizzeria.  BUT, the pizza was worthless.   The whole pizza tasted the same and had no texture.  There were about six mushrooms on top of the pizza, the crust was soft and mushy.  Sorry guys and gals, the truth hurts.

IirS6ZiK4-R85sWcR63_lA.text: My husband is from the East Coast and we recently ordered the supreme pizza and the white pizza and he said by far is the best pizza he has ever had West of the Mississippi. We have ordered from here several times service is prompt and the pizza is always screaming hot.  The anti pasto and caprese salad are also both excellent

dESApyE5_6OWq8g23H2ZPw.text: Ok so for years I've watched this location change from one pizza shop to the next.... some owned by middle easterners ... some by nice family from the Midwest and now a New York settlement has planted their roots at this spot and I couldn't be any happier.   Ok so my go to is their cheese pizza. The amount of cheese is out of bounds , the dough of the pizza is perfect it's just a great pie.   I've had their supreme and wasn't thrilled it was over burden with sauteed veggies that weighed the pizza down and made it soggy so I basically couldn't eat it. I for and knifed it and I love love love veggies and I'd love for this place to make a pizza with just fresh toppings nothing cooked all ready because I like my veggies a bit al Dente.   Regardless of that supreme pie flop it was will tasty.   Well today I got my daughter and her friends a large cheese pie as this is their new fav pizza and I see this slice and it looks so inviting and hearty and I say hey what's that the nice lady with the shirt brunette hair replies "Lasagna pizza" I immediately go I want one now  I love lasagna so how could this be bad right??  Right ! It was amazing the velvety ricotta that blanked out the salty lasagna meats and sauce that was just folded perfectly over this dough I was in heaven I took one bite and said omg I have to text this to someone and showed friends and now here I am writing a review while finishing this pizza slice of life !   I think people love this place because of the amount of toppings but I suggest you make two pizza options light or heavy ! Have two price brackets and those who want heavy on the toppings can pay heavy prices and hose who like a nice balance can pay a bit less.   Just my opinion. Anyhow this is Jen of my top 3 fav pizza spots in Las Vegas.   The people are spectacular. I will say before there were some young ladies one with short blonde hair the other I've cast out of my memory and no matter how many hi's or pleasantries I sent to them they were never receptive , pleasant or responsive. Their customer service was horrid but now I see two older ladies as the other two probably early 18-22 well these two new ladies are heaven !   They are so sweet pleasant and kind. It makes all the difference it balances out the smart ass ways of the men in the kitchen and I'm sure those ladies can hold their own but what they give out to the world and their customers is genuine kindness and consideration and I appreciate it and thank them! Very tip worthy those two I'll have to find out their names !   Anyhow can't wait to see what I try next as I'm eager to venture into their pastas since this lasagna pizza has that traditional authentic lasagna flavor you want to taste. No spins ... no twists ... just traditional lasagna flavors on a pizza. A lovely meat sauce , cheeses and doses of ricotta on top.  So wondrous everyone should try it $4 a slice and I'm so full I can't breathe !  Oh and as to the Authenticity of this being a True New York Pizza I can't say because I am not a native of New York but I can say by my encounters with their clients I would say it is Def an authentic NYC style pizza !   Enjoy you won't be sorry

hqYXwwJCaSTQQfqoLu6vSA.text: The Grandmas pizza is amazing! We took extra pieces to go because it was just too good to leave behind! This place has great service and great food! The staff makes great recommendations and they seem to really care about their food. They come by to check how you like it and try and give you the best experience. The chicken Stromboli was delicious. The Sicilian pizza was also amazing. This is the place to go for an east coast pizza experience, something that's hard to find out west!

VC6SkHy2VwtBZIB6j_SOoQ.text: Such a great hole in the wall place. Love the east coast atmosphere and delicious food! As soon as chef sees me he throws mussels on the pan because he knows that I'm addicted to them! Simply amazing. And pizza is always made just the way it's supposed to be! We have not had a bad meal here.  Thank you for great food, friendly service and keep up good work!

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

yB6FHHmaZxLhLm0dfiYPQQ.text: Im going to give them 5 stars again. The food is spot on. Had a wood fire pizza and traditional and chicken fingers for the family. They are just so slooooooow. I think they need to hire a professional to run the front while the rest just concentrate on making the food and getting it out. Until then, i will only be back at off hours

I2DoQJxEQiSA2iYvgGblaw.text: A place after my own heart. From the parking lot, I could see the Boston sports memorabilia and I was already a fan. Then we talked to the guys who own it, who the people I was with were good friends with, and they were such great guys. The food was so good. We had the garlic knots, mozzarella sticks, and then pizzas. I was stuffed upon leaving, but I was a happy camper. They also had televisions playing college football, which made the experience even better.  The only this that could have made this experience top notch? If they served beer. I was dying for one with the delicious pizza. But besides that, I definitely give this place an A, and will try to go back next time I am in town.

ZUMTHUyNeE8zVHYljxz6Sw.text: My parents took my daughters and me here for dinner on Mother's Day. The food here is so very good!! The portions are very big. We had the mussels and chicken wings ( for the girls) as appetizers. The mussels were perfectly cooked, not tough or chewy. Plus the portion was very large for the price. If you ordered this dish on the strip, you would easily pay triple the amount at least. Ask for extra bread to mop up the amazing sauce that's on the mussels. The flavor is unbelievable. The chicken wings were very flavorful too. We also had chicken parmigiana, baked ziti, chicken francese, and a pizza. All very delicious and again ample portions. You will bring home leftovers. Try this place. You won't be disappointed. On a side note, my parents have been back several times since the Mothers's Day visit and my mother really likes one of the desserts, the Italian cheesecake. They went on a Sunday and they were out. My mother told the owner that they were coming back to eat there for their anniversary ( which was just a few days away) he told her he would have it for her. When they returned a few days later, he was True to his word and had the Italian cheesecake for her. Very nice family run restaurant.

YPDX2PGMWE7U5UuyVzExTg.text: Although I do not care for the red sox, I enjoyed the atmosphere. The owners have that boston attitude but do it carefully not to sound threatening, while having fun and needling. We were going back and forth and having a good time, my kids enjoyed it.  We got 4 slices of plain, $2/slice isn't terrible pretty standard. I loved it. Thin crust with a nice crisp and you can fold it in half and just chow on down! My kids split a chicken bomb sub, was delicious! Like a chicken cheese steak almost! The service was ok, the other people that work there besides the owner just don't seem to be into it as much. Understandable. Love the place though and wish them all the luck! Keep it up!

iPN1Gymn7j6xpy74SnCWJw.text: Simple and bomb food. Nice little nook in the wall, great to chill and enjoy pizza.

YiNkhlrpoRqOZrEz7FOarg.text: Best Pizza west of the Hudson!  It's authentic, tasty and brings me back to the delicious pizza I grew up with in NYC.  Even Matt's calzone's are the best.  This is the only place I will eat pizza and/or a calzone in Las Vegas.  It doesn't get more real than Bambino's.

N1w5G4AzsQf5vJIod3nemQ.text: Perfect wings, perfect fingers, and some  bomb ass pizza! I love this place its my weekly Saturday night pizza joint! The service is great everone that works there is really friendy! Shout out to the girl that always makes our food, you definetly put love into it!I also get zeppoles every time and they are hella bomb! Great place great food and great service! What else do you need?

S6PpMDlcuYefESpxP1syug.text: totally respectable take-out pizza.  an upgrade on cheese quality would be nice.

X6cr2mQmR94MZh-gY9jBYQ.text: Bambino's is right up the street from me, so after scoping the place out for several months during my morning runs, I purchased their LivingSocial deal and finally got take-out from here one night.  Overall I was very satisfied with the food -- it was very reasonably priced and most importantly, really good!! Here's what we got:  Garlic Knots ($3) - 6 jumbo buttery garlic knots almost the size of my fist (though I do have kind of small hands, hehe) with lots of marinara sauce - YUM!!!  Chicken Wings ($6) - 10 large breaded chicken wings tossed in your choice of sauce.  These were awesome and at only $6 for 10 wings, a nice deal!  16" Large Meatball Pizza ($13.50) - This is a BIG pizza for a pretty good price; great sauce, crust, cheese... definitely skimpy on the toppings though; I would've expected double the amount of meatballs :(  Despite the lack of pizza toppings, I'd totally go back here because the food was great and you definitely get a LOT of it for your money.  Service was good too and as someone from New England, it was nice to hear the Boston accent :) I look forward to going back!

MZ5l5oQaOE7tf95pa2nZ2A.text: Great place! I have been coming here since the first week they opened.  Pizza is excellent and service is top notch. Owners are great people.  A small place with welcoming atmosphere.

WmQ9qy96ExmbuM2tTx4EMw.text: great place. food is A+. so is the staff and the service. first time there. ordered salad, pizza, calzon. all very good.

O3nYdkEfSryzo-ckL7BEpg.text: Good pizza, thin crust, nice amount of sauce and cheese. The salad was fresh, crisp, and very large.  Excellent lunch deal: pizza, salad, and a drink for around $7.

uFoTOTACU3l45eHDDfoZrA.text: Just had their special 2 slices of cheese and a soda! Very big slices nice and thin and crispy! Very good!

XVKb-rD_-Wp3aDNXD3QqiA.text: When I am in town visiting family, I always have to come by and get a pizza. The pizza is thin crust and the sauce is delicious and the cheese is too. I am from Massachusetts and so are the owners, so they know how to make a pizza!

J3OKlP799aKMlPZlYlu_xw.text: Meatball sub is a must try. Meatballs are tender, sauce is great and bread is good and crusty. Top it with cheese of course.  White pizza was good. It was a little dry for my taste, but full of flavor. The ricotta was super creamy, garlic didn't overpower, and crust was perfect.

neMwAL7KyYRc-MGVO-povg.text: I had a Caesar Salad and a Pizza Margherita. Both were delicious. The pizza Is a thin crust cooked in their wood-fired oven. Fantastic!

iZWDIyeWUAIxvw3xVKlcag.text: best pizza I have had in Las Vegas in 20 years....and they answer the phone with a authentic New York accent....terrific little place....

fuJprWTPLU8mXotoD00aOg.text: This Little Pizza joint is very close to my working place. every time my wife need cheese and pepperoni pizza, i can even walk to this place and buy it in 10 mins wait. Owner is super friendly and the place is really clean. its remind me the NY theme under the bridge pizza. :) all around the food is fresh and tasty. That's what i am counting on.

dAaPBu3FgU7ejC5b5qOrxg.text: Good things first.  Delivery was very fast (20-25 minutes).  Sauce was great, good crust and the price was right. I'm a chicago pizza person so i like a ton of cheese.  I ordered extra cheese and there was as much cheese as i'd expect without extra cheese.  The sausage was good but it was very sparse, they definitely don't load you down with toppings.

OzmQZYwMAlPAcSlva_O43g.text: Love this place. If you are looking for a great tasting spaghetti and meatball dinner or penne pasta and meatballs look no further! Trust me you will not be disappointed. You can't beat the price or the taste if you go anywhere else. My husband Eric and i are just hooked! We just love their meatballs. My husband orders the garlic knots all the time and they are so good! . We have dealt with a lot of pizza places here in Vegas and this one is definitely one of our favorites. They are so nice too. I have also ordered the meatball parmesan sub over a dozen times. It is so delicious! One of my favorites at Bambino's. After reading these reviews now I am dying to try their calzones! I hope this place never goes out of business. We just love it. The pasta dinners are only $7 bucks, where can you get that anywhere else???? I'm so sick of these pizza places that charge you $13 bucks for spaghetti and meatballs.Really????  Thank You Bambinos for the great value for the dollar! You guys are awesome!!!!!!!

uoyIkkxsbfkHzPS2oYqrOA.text: Freakin awesome! From the moment we got our mozzarella sticks the marinara dipping sauce was the sign that the pizza was going to be even better. Customer service is outstanding, the staff is very friendly. Well worth my 30 minute drive for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep dish pizza

8JOy4uBdVO0IFOgGcKwahw.text: I used to love this place. I was so excited I could get real ny pizza in Vegas.   Fast forward tonight: Order grandma pie with pepperoni, told to wait 25 minute to pick up. Arrived after 17 minute because I walked there and got there earlier. It was sitting in a box on their cool rack so I was confused but continued home.   My friends and I all too a slice realizing it was extremely greasy.  I know with peporoni it's gonna be greasy but hot oil was getting all over our hands it was really gross. I bit into the pizza and it was just doughy. Not fully cooked.   I called them to see what they can do to fix it. Since I had 5 friends over and we each took a slice they wouldn't just get me a new one next time or refund my order. I used to come here a lot. But unfortunate this was the last straw came, spent 20 dollars for semi raw dough with cheese and oil.   Oh and when he was asking whoever what to do, you should press the hold/ mute button. I heard him. Also when you put me on hold, I again heard the entire order you took. But whatever, I guess.

Kzluxi-EVdWuOillyOXPoA.text: I love this little hole in the wall place.  I called a few years ago, not long after new owners took over. I asked if they can make a bunch of pizzas for my son's birthday party.  He went in early to make the pizza's so they were ready right when they opened. And it was SO GOOD! This is our favorite go-to pizza now.   I've also had the chicken parm dinner and that was also tasty.   They are always so nice and hard working. :)

lslKNcWwKygeZtg3ZVb2Ow.text: Decided to stop by Bambinos after driving by a million times and noticing they do pizza by the slice at lunch.  I was craving New York style cheese pizza and this place did NOT disappoint.   The slices were absolutely delicious.   $6.22 for two big slices of cheese pizza, drink and side of ranch (extra charge, that's why it was not $5, which I'm totally good with cause it's delicious and a large size compared to other places)   Awesome deal and awesome food.   Next time I'm trying the Grandma slice! Looked delicious!  Almost forgot to review the service, I was in and out in about 3-5 minutes. Everyone was friendly was attentive when i walked in. Great service and great good. I'll be back for sure. Maybe next time I'll share with my husband! Probably not...

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $6.22 after tax. Great deal!

TrOIyNoKP-NJ0T1C5W0PVA.text: So last night I stopped in, recommended to me from a friend and WOW Bambino's is excellent to start off about the Staff they are great extremely friendly and helpful. Now for the food we had the Grandma Pie half pepperoni half mushroom and it was perfect and I'm picky about pizza it was Delicious. We also ordered the Garlic Knotts that were also Delicious. The Large Antipasto was no joke it was large, fresh and awesome. We also ordered a Sausage, cheese, and pepper Stromboli which was very good also. Then don't know how we had room but the Canoli's and Cheesecake topped it off. Highly recommend trying it out. Thanks again to the Staff....

XrBRd9q8D-d54TV90P1MNQ.text: I don't care how far this place is from my house, it is the best pizza in the city. It's thin, it's crispy, and just perfect. Best grandma pie you can find in Vegas.

steTLbH5tucHvDOU06JynA.text: Finally! I found a pizzeria in LV that is as close to NY style pizza as you can get.   As a NY native and pizza lover, I've been searching for a pizzeria like the ones in NY.   My search is now over. Bambino's Pizzeria makes delicious pizzas and authentic Italian entrees, just like the food I grew accustomed to eating while in New York.   Ralf, John, and the rest of the Bambino staff are friendly, welcoming, and hospitable people and have made me a loyal, happy, and satisfied regular customer.

yCCiT_zs-GuFTKVsmmgomg.text: Hidden gem! A friend had raved about this place and for years I've been meaning to try it.. I finally talked my husband into going because I was craving New York style pizza. This was EXACTLY what I was looking for and is our new favorite treat! The crust is perfectly charred and the sauce is flavorful but well balanced. Everyone should try this pizza!

arhBWaZnmyhACQAMfDYiJQ.text: Love the chic parm Everything great so far!  Went there another night that the owner he bought me a slice of pizza sat down with me at my table great customer service the waitress there is really sweet I'm loving this place I can't wait to go back

LNfQU7YuMua-dZVOpo6X7w.text: One of the best neighborhood pizza places around. The slices are cut to proper size (not micro cuts like you get at the corporate places) the ingredients are fresh and they don't cut corners when it comes to portion or quality.   Great people, excellent service and outstanding food. Can't ask for much more than that!

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hearty Rigatoni!

YZ3Euvg5EVEQZw6WVTy6JA.text: I ordered a large cheese pizza for pickup. The pizza was GREAT! Perfect crust, just the right amount of sauce and cheese, Great taste! This is how New York Neopolitan style pizza is made!  The staff is friendly, the restaurant is clean. This is going to be my favorite place for pizza.  I was a little apprehensive to try them because the previous owners made some really bad stuff. But once I opened the box and took a bite, I wasn't disappointed. Can't wait to try their other items!

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grandma pizza with meatballs!

aww4_d1g0oj6odBZrrHYlQ.text: Cant say anything bad about this place . It has a cozy atmosphere, friendly people and good food . You cant go wrong here.  The service is great they check on you and make sure you get your food soon as its done . Ill definitely be coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium Pineapples and sausage pizza

VBYGoaTCmRNaFnyRqn5mTQ.text: Fantastic pizza. They are generous with their toppings, and while I've never dined in, I always appreciate how they offer to carry my pizza to the car for me when I have my kids with me.  The garlic knots are top notch - not overly garlicky so that vampires run for the hills.    It's not national chain cheap, but it's comparable to any mom-and-pop pizza joint. Quality food and quality people. I'd over pay for that any day.

iNeTOzCEeltwygU4Je-b5A.text: Originally from ny city. Been in Vegas for 18 years. This place is the closest thing to ny style pizza that I could find and have sampled a lot trying to find something remotely close. Wish I had stopped in sooner instead of driving by thinking another place with ny or easy coast on it trying to be. Well worth the drive and when your three teenagers say it's just as good from a visit to ny then it's got to be. A must try

_28mdCIXYs6Ae9lUhHFlaQ.text: Had a very disappointing experience tonight at this restaurant.! We ordered a Sicilian pizza and a salad and it took 40 minutes to receive the pizza. Other patrons who ordered after us received their orders before us. When one of the waitresses inquired as to why we were still waiting, I told her we were waiting on a pizza. There was some commotion in the kitchen and our pizza came out maybe 10 minutes later. No acknowledgment from the owner and no apology. Our bill was 42.00 without tip. We will be sure to tell our family about this and all of our acquaintances. We won't be back and no one seemed to care except for the lovely lady who lead us out the door. I guess they don't need or appreciate our business.  Our money will be better spent elsewhere.

ylB414djhgXN2e71298aZg.text: Hands down the best pizza in Vegas! This former New Yorker puts this place in his top five in the country. Awesome! The white pizza is the best I've ever had and my favorite. The new deep dish is killer too with a perfect crust! These guys remember your name and you feel like more than a customer. My girl gets the rice balls and says they are amazing as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best white pizza you will ever have!

d3Slx9NVV_-PEZIQYqTAEA.text: I'm so bummed to only give this place one star because I've had some great experiences with the quality of their food, however, their inconsistency's have over shadowed the quality. From the amount of sauce, to the amount of toppings, to even the very taste of the food itself. But my order today was the worst by far. My coworkers and I ordered a large order for delivery and the tomato sauce was INEDIBLE. This wasn't just a taste preference (ie, bland, too much oregano) but it actually tasted like something was off or it had turned. We called to let them know, the girl put me on hold, and when she returned she said " I spoke with the owner, and he said there's nothing I can do for you and that's just how the sauce tastes." First off we weren't looking for any freebies and we just wanted to let them know because it was truly inedible. Two of us regularly order from them and the sauce has NEVER tasted like this. To disregard a customers concern with out even checking the quality of the food your are serving is unacceptable. Sad that a place with so much promise isn't taking pride in the consistency of the food they serve.

0BeVaGpbIbSWPxzLfBMErQ.text: Came here on a recommendation from a buddy after a Facebook debate on Vegas' best pizza.  Am I glad I did.  I'm a big fan of Metro and Rocco's for their NY style, but this is as authentic NY as you'll get.    I wanna thank Metro's for their years of service to my stomach, but I found a new spot now.  Their tomato sauce is so good.  It's not too acidic but just enough to remind you that you're having tomatoes, not apples.  The mozzarella was rich so you got that famous string that stretches when you bite into it.  Don't think it's just "heat" that does that.  It's also the ingredients in it.    On the way out, they even gave me a slice (on the house) of this round deep dish pizza.  I was thrown off.  I never ate a deep dish back in NY.  When I bit into it, it wasn't dense like these Chicago pizzas.  It had the fluffiness that a Sicilian slice has.  I friggin' loved it and can't wait to thank them when I return.    If you're also yearning for that NY slice and have also been asleep on this gem, go now.

WnTGBhU4Lg7u_QP8e7RygQ.text: This is my favorite place to get just a couple slices. Good size, good crust, good flavor

HsusZ5kjEfdQCUi48tKJUw.text: Great food!! Being a New Yorker, I feel at home here! The staff is super friendly as well!!

jrtd3eqPfzdKTsSOy5q4Mw.text: Incredibly overpriced, extremely greasy, but at least the food poisioning was free. By the way, chicken wings aren't dry because there isn't sauce on them, but because they're overcooked.

WFwzGGHS-0XC0ef60JsNBw.text: We are big New York style pizza eaters, so we try out as many pizza spots as possible. The first time we ate Bambino's was by delivery. It was so delicious. 68HqYK_iTjGF5M3PmYsRjw.text: We love pizza and have eaten it across America and in many countries including Italy. We've learned to appreciate the many styles of pizza and love them all. We've been driving by Bambino's for several months and finally decided to stop for dinner this last Friday. It reminded us of little joints from the "NY neighborhood " where my husband grew up. The Caesar salad was excellent and a nice start to the meal. We ordered the meat lovers pizza and it's a hit. The crust was tasty and nicely crispy but still had a good chew. We finished with the house special cannoli that was a perfect finish. The service is spot on and I loved having the owner and her parents in the dining room and kitchen. We love supporting local businesses and recommend you give them a try.

TEq60BK_V-9wHr9dHpOifw.text: It was my first visit today. I tried a 14 inch cheese pie because, if they can't do that right, there is no reason to go any further. Quite simply, it was the best pie I have experienced in over 20 years in Las Vegas. It had body, the crust had the perfect char, an equally perfect amount of cheese and the sauce was that perfect mix of gentle sweetness and tang. Everybody claims they make NY pizza, so it is no small task trying to find one that is actually credible to reach that lofty goal. Rest assured, this is it... no need to look elsewhere. I will be back regularly. Also the young lady at the counter was perfectly pleasant. A win/win for everyone.

bWNU2V6ivO3I4gQDGOq7lQ.text: Awesome, Affordable, Authentic.    This family run business from Long Island is one of my favorites for Pizza and Wings and they have some pastas that are great as well.  The service is always exceptional and prompt.   Prices are very competitive.   If you're looking for a new favorite pizza stop I would highly suggest trying this  place out.

xiZM078tI_1QdwO1AwDgCA.text: Where do I begin?  This place was FANTASTIC!!  We just moved to this area from Centennial Hills and we are literally 1 block from Bambino's so decided that pizza sounded great.  I had no idea, though just how great this would be!!  So impressed with the nice servers that were very attentive and had patience with us since my 15-month-old was trying to destroy/eat everything they brought to our table!  We had the special for $19....a HUGE CHEESE PIZZA with 10 crispy and very flavorful wings.  Also had another special for our party and had pepperoni & jalapenos put on.  AMAAAAAZING!!!!  The mozzarella they use has the best flavor and texture.....and wow the sauce!!!!  Pizzas are wood-fired so the crust is a bubbly, crispy perfection that I always look for.  They have Italian seasonings right at the table to up the flavor even more so......we could not have enjoyed it any more and I will be back over and over again!!!!  Yum!!!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A close-up of the jalapeño/pepperoni perfection.

ylZmldHr9LTTF6UP6N_y2Q.text: I have ordered here several times. Picked up two pies tonight, so oily and pizza looked horrible like it was sitting and reheated. Very disappointed this time. Not to sound like an ass but I'm from NY and know pizza this time it's not even close to NY pizza, maybe Jersey pizza (lol). Go down a few blocks to Villa Pizza on Durango more consistent.

AGSRZ_5I9ElX5xUpvMzCnA.text: Very friendly family owned with great food and atmosphere.  Great place to go with family and friends.

mH8GfhbRlMV_a9mR9iuD_Q.text: Bambinos - New York heroes fighting fires and retiring in Las Vegas opened a New York style wood oven pizzeria in Las Vegas named Bambinos on Durango and Sahara next to Stephanie's spa. I will tell you more about Stephanie; but you have to try this authentic cheesy, tasty pizza.  Each slice is fantastic. I ordered two slices with NYFD Firefighters Mike Tomko preparing everyone for the September 11 Tribute next week along Fremont Street and ended up buying a large pie with their special red sauce to take home for my kid's dinner. I don't think he ever had pizza this good in his life. The chef does something special with wood, filtered water, and pizza dough, the fire fighters tell the story best. The lunch crowd came in large numbers with moms ordering up to three large pizza pies. As I said, I took one home unexpectedly. Groups came in and took up tables. Delicious, absolutely delicious slice of New York. Follow the NYFD in Las Vegas to taste wood stove baked pizza in Summerlin, Las Vegas, Nevada. Lunch specials : Two cheese slices with a soda for lunch $5.00.

My daughter thinking that she cooked the pizza looks at me and goes "Mommy that girl bakes a good pizza"..lol. It was a chill place and I thought it was cute the older couples coming in for the special and chatting with the staff. You could tell they were regulars and the staff interaction was just cute. Would definitely recommend it really did remind me of back East!

NN_8G5XG9M31MeZKATqQFQ.text: Amazing pizza elaboration!  Had the chicken bacon ranch. Perfect crust, great cheese, kick ass flavor!  Loved it.

Every time I come here it feels like I'm in an authentic pizzeria and the atmosphere feels like you're right at home, I always feel comfortable when I'm in here. -16LAzdT1uDw9kJPvQOZTg.text: I have always loved pizza and I prefer the love given to pizza by mom and pop type places than by chain pizza places. You could feel the love at Bambino's from the sport memorabilia to the checkered tablecloths. You can order slices or entire pizzas. There are a salads, fries, garlic knots,calzones as well as other dishes, but all I care about is PIZZA!  My cheese/pepperoni was tasty= sauce, cheese, crust, etc. My wonderful Yelp friend, Lisa G graciously offered me some of her vegetarian pizza and I was in heaven!  For desert Marie T and I suggest  the buttered/powdered sugared balls of deliciousness that are hot and fresh out of the oven.  The place is not very big, so if you have a large group, maybe taking your order to go is a better option.

aljjYt5pGnd2dsCnfTBghA.text: The best Italian restaurant in Vegas. Family style and kid friendly. The food and pizza delicious, a family owned very friendly. We come here often, excellent service. Tonight we're having pizza and salad so yummy.

9LOD8rNtGNUypPmtgo0zHw.text: Amazing pizza! Honestly, how is it that we've never been to Bambino's pizza?! We were craving pizza on a Monday night and decided to check out Bambino's after a friend recommended going there and verifying good reviews on Yelp.  We arrived an hour before closing but the owner and staff were so welcoming, and we knew it would be good since it was still fairly busy.  As per Yelp reviews, we decided to try the white pizza (usually my favorite), 'grandma's pizza, garlic knots and the cannoli.  The garlic knots came first: piping hot, crunchy on the outside and chewy soft inside. Make sure to dip it in the extra garlic butter sauce in the bottom of the plate and the sauce that comes with it. Then comes the white pizza: amazing flavor, simple white pizza yet complex and delicious in flavor! White pizza is usually my favorite order, but from the other Yelp reviews, we also decided to order 'grandma's pizza. WOW. Everyone is right. You HAVE to try it. Simple yet savory, slightly sweet sauce, perfect blend of cheese. Then comes the cannoli. I'll be honest, my hubby loves cannoli but it's usually not my favorite. This was the BEST cannoli I've had (and I've even eaten them while in New York!). Not only was the food delicious, the staff and people were fantastic! Such wonderful characters (most of the 'regulars' we met were from Staton Island, Long Island, etc). We were saying this place needs to be on Food Network-it was that good! We will certainly be returning again soon (someone recommended the lasagna pie) and will be recommending this new favorite to our family and friends!

bm1VAMfUpzGT8doAubupgA.text: * Customer service: 4/5 These guys are very nice, greeted us upon arrival, didn't charge us for last minute extra sauce and offered to serve the garlic knots before receiving our to-go pizza.  * Cleanliness: 5/5 The restaurant was VERY CLEAN. Both the kitchen and tables were spotless.  * Food and portion size: 4/5 We ordered a large half pepperoni and half Hawaiian with extra sauce. The pizza hardly had any sauce, cheese was average, but wasn't greasy and the crust was GREAT (cooked in a brick oven, fresh taste, not too thin and not too thick). But the pepperoni portion was VERY SALTY. I am assuming it was salty because of the pepperoni because the Hawaiian was PERFECT.   As for the garlic knots, they were GREAT! Nice soft bread with just the right amount of garlic and butter. The marinara sauce used for dipping was excellent (very fresh and tasted original).   Portion sizes were perfect for two-four people.  * Atmosphere, room capacity, and menu size: 4/5 Restaurant is conveniently located next to a 7/11 in the newer looking plaza. The interior is up-to-date and casual. It's a good size restaurant with a simple menu.  * Price: 5/5 Price was perfect for a large with four toppings ($16.00).   * Recommend or return? I would definitely recommend this place and return, I LOVE the fact that they use a brick oven! The only reason I gave an overall 4/5 is because how salty the pepperoni pizza was. But maybe it was just that time and day...

5fFdibT5CeTotSHt2shXWw.text: Service was good, pizza  was good similar tasting to pizza from NY. Meatballs and clams were good as Well  over all a pleasant experience. Food was  brought out in a timely manner.

4vD9dSr2iIUkqzHVCDaY_A.text: I normally don't do reviews unless I've tried a place out a few times. I have to say though, that our family truly enjoyed this small place with big tasting quality NY pizza. Service was friendly and professional. Our waitress, Jennifer was awesome. This guy making the pizza, obviously knows his stuff. Can't wait to go back. Our 3 and almost 2 year old grandchildren never ate so much. We had a Supreme and a cheese and sausage. Crust was great and the toppings fresh and with lots of flavor. As Arnold would say..... I'LL BE BACK!!!!!!!

youdk4pz_8KT_6QpSXY7sA.text: We eat here once every 3 months since the new owners took over and generally it's decent food and service. This time, 2 out of the 4 items we ordered had a single hair on it. It sounds cliche, but it happened...  We were disappointed and discussed, so much that I signed up for a yelp account just to vent. I'm not sure if we'll return and give them another shot..there is a pizza shop on every corner!  *owner said they are implementing new protocol and offered to make things right with us..we are definitely not looking for a free meal, just a good pie!   We shall visit again in the near future  and give them another shot.

hkknRo1sf6JMiPheOaFB0A.text: Solid Italian restaurant with no frills amazing food.  I had the baked clams with herbed bread crumbs, sauteed spinach, chicken francese, fettuccine alfredo, and cannoli.  The baked clams were tender, not over cooked, with their clam juice, and the herbed bread crumbs complimented the clams nicely, just a squeeze of lemon made it on point.  The sauteed spinach was chopped and cooked soft with burnt garlic, if you are a garlic fan you would enjoy this dish.  The Chicken francese dish had tender chicken with a bright acidic white wine sauce and spaghetti, I have an affinity for acidity and this dish more than satisfied my pH-of-less-than-7 palette.  Solid, solid fettuccine alfredo and they have a strong, like Mr. Olympia-strong, cannoli game.  I will end my review with a quote from Scorpion from Mortal Kombat..."GET OVER HERE!"

Ap20bEs9QSYHRPcTKJLNlQ.text: My Slices and pies still arrive piping hot and it's even better "Well Done" to get the full experience. They're slowly sneaking up on the Buffalo wing game also! As the wings have gotten a bit bigger also.

rTKeLXRCVuGNyy5OdBiHgQ.text: Best pizza in town by far. The cheese and sauce  make the pie. I could almost eat this everyday. #1 pizza

rWqkmFI6DOWZo_IGujxQuw.text: Being a NYC transplant, and of Italian descent, I find most pizza/italian food in Vegas sub-par at best. Not Bambino's, their food is excellent. In addition, they several different pizzas that are impossible to find in Vegas - White Pizza (Amazing!!!!!), Grandma's Pizza (If you've never had it, TRY it), Deep Dish (WOW), and their Sicilian (square) is better than New York shops. I can't say enough about John, he's a friendly guy who makes each customer feel comfortable and welcome. For top-notch Pizza or Italian food, Try this place, you won't be disappointed.

V6-gqnefvMPOydP2gKAl0g.text: Had great time and a lot of laughs and totally enjoyed the place. Highly recommended the place and the people especially John thanks for a good time.

rr_s_t3JJf2WapdcFquKIQ.text: By far one of the best pizza joints in town!! This little hidden gem, sells it by the slice or whole pie. Thin New York Style, Sicilian, white pizza, etc.  I had the Chicken Parmesan hero, perfect!! Not only is the food great but so is the service!! They also sell pastas which I'll be trying next visit!!

W1svcbGRRllZAKsZ2gD7QQ.text: It's a small place, and we were a big group of ladies out for our once a month Ladies' Night Out.  We kinda took over the place and were a little loud, but that's because we were having such a good time and stuffing our faces on what turned out to be great food.  Since we all ordered what we wanted but ended up sharing, there was a big assortment of items to try.    Three friend and I shared a white pizza, which was scrumptious, and a large salad that, thankfully, was romaine and not iceberg, which had a very good ranch dressing that we had on the side.  There were other dressings to choose from.  We also got to sample the garlic knots, veggie pizza, and the calzone.  Everything was terrific, but the calzone was extra wonderful!    What I love most about Bambino's pizza is that the crust is not overly salty; so many other pizza joints drown their crusts in salt.  This one was perfect, and crispy, just the way I love it.  The white pizza had just the right amount of chopped garlic, creamy ricotta, and extra seasonings that bumped it up several notches in flavor.  Great service, too, from a family-owned establishment that I hope will be around for a long time.

VC_tNtSgdC-R9FKJ6nta9g.text: Best White pizza in town & they made a Big Mike(that's me) special that was AMAZING! I have brought friends from NY here & they say it's just as good as home. The staff are Fantastic, friendly & always asking if we need anything!

MZtRQMIRSVV0W1VlsZkgpA.text: So good! I came here with 5 of my coworkers. We all loved our food. The French fries were perfect and ranch is good. I had an antipasto salad that impressed me. It was big and had delicious toppings like fresh grilled red peppers, fresh chunks of mozzarella, meats, baby Swiss, two kinds of olives etc. I got the larger $9 one and couldn't finish it. Very satisfying. I'll definitely go back.

-A78aFSdFRw5pN9LVz1Wew.text: The best grandma pizza!  Co worker recommended bambino and I'm so happy we tried it!  Staff is great place is clean really can't say enough good things

RYQ7V5J3OUbD-4fOv6D7UA.text: Just came back with a Supreme(?) pizza from here. I ate one slice and so did my friend. We threw the rest away. I can't believe all the 4 and 5 star reviews!! The onions were edible but the rest of the ingredients were so sub par I don't want to use the correct description. Sauce-lousy, pepperoni-tasteless,cheese-blah,sausage-forgetabout it. Just terribly bad all around. This is not like any other "back east" pizza I've ever had. I grew up in So.New England and know good New Haven and New York style pizza. There are too many good pizza places in Vegas now so I can't think of one good reason to ever go back. I'm going to go chew on my socks to get the taste out of my mouth.

rN-FTUCPYhD0gswVANI96w.text: I love eating at Bambino's! It has some Yankees stuff on the walls, but it more of a Babe Ruth Vibe than a Yankees place. The service has always been top notch, quick to get orders and refills. They serve beer and wine, have two TVs and have good Parking. I can eat a whole pizza here and ten wings, I encourage you to bring a friend though :) chefs are right around the corner so you can peek in on the magic, and the fries lace has windows on two walls so you don't feel claustrophobic! Some floor space makes it more intimate, i would guess seating for 40, but almost every time I'm there, some tables are shifted to sit a ten top, so bring the whole crew!

yMBKYIBfTCvRgkdX4WyAkA.text: My fiance and I use to always go here. We didn't feel like coming so decided to order in a pizza. I've seen rumors of new management, not sure if it's True or not but our pizza was just alright this time (it's been awhile since we've eaten here) We ordered a medium pepperoni pizza that was $15. I'm fine with paying prices for great quality food worth it but our pizza was very very greasy and almost soggy like. The grease was literally dripping down our hands onto our forearms,For that price we expected better. And the stomach ache that came along because of that wasn't fun.   Customer service is always great and the young woman who took our order over phone was very sweet and professional, along with all the staff when you walk in, but I didn't like that they don't let customers know about their daily deals. As we walked up to pick up our pizza they had a chalk board sign with their deal of the day that included one LARGE pizza and wings for $19.99 we would've just opted for that had we known so that was pretty annoying being that we spent $15 for half of that Maybe it's our fault for not asking but as a business why not let your customer know? Especially because we would've got more bang for our buck.   Regardless we didn't like how greasy and soggy it was. We've gotten the chicken fingers before as well and those are really good. Not sure if we'll be back anytime soon though.

PkZt5dimg75ZXB9WjgmTww.text: Definitely not "East Coast" pizza; perhaps "Vegas" pizza. The reviews are above par, but extremely misleading. We got it delivered (via Grubhub) and were hungry after a long day. The two pizzas and garlic knots were not at all what we were expecting, Papa Murphy's would beat Ol Bambino in a contest - pathetic, but True. Worst money we've spent on food in a very long time. Too bad we decided to actually read the reviews after biting into the first slice and realizing Ol Bambino stuck it to us. Now, I guess we wait for the upset stomach to follow... Good Luck to all eat here! We are trashing the rest of the pizza = $60. We are not going to argue with disrespectful sub-par pizza makers/cashiers.   Attention Owner: Call DiGiorno (may have seen their commercial on tv) and ask if they can provide some insight. I understand they specialize in frozen pizzas, but as of now, they have you beat in quality and flavor. Your restaurant could use any/all help it could get. Really.

iqtgKtwHmeaktmD_jNNNbg.text: We had a great dinner tonight at Bambinos! Some friends were in town and we had to bring them to Bambinos. Rosie took care of us and our friends loved everything, especially, the mozzarella sticks (my personal favorite). We had pizza, chicken parm with spaghetti, antipasto salad, garden salad, garlic  knots, and of course, mozzarella sticks.  It's just not about the great food, it's about the familial and warm feeling when entering the door. It's about knowing our names and our stories. Finally, it's about supporting our local businesses. Thank you everyone at Bambinos for showing our out of town friends a wonderful experience!  Jan and Dan

PDem1JjJAHLPp4FEfcRi6Q.text: All n all a good joint. Nice people. Clean and nice atmosphere. My wife likes the cheap mass produced commercial pizza places. I love these local joints. Now that is not a complaint because they were not cheap when it came to toppings. Probably had a touch to much sauce but the sauce was tasty n I am not a big pizza sauce guy. Good work guys and I'll be back. N if you haven't tried it support your local joints and try it. U won't be disappointed.

dt_gjZRHKEaq885xCp_UKg.text: Amazing pizza! Well worth the drive from Centennial Hills. NY style pizza in Las Vegas. Crust is perfect.. atmosphere is very casual... good prices...

C9tTdxqkW2HyrhNFrl8-fQ.text: Stopped in here in my way home from a friends. Heard about them from right here on yelp. I'm from The NYC/NJ metro area and to say we are pizza snobs is an understatement. When I walked in I felt like I was back home. While the place is small to eat inside, the food portion is not. I had a chicken stromboli. It was large enough for one and was very good. Everything here they make to order! Fresh! And all with a wood burning stove to cook with! That makes a huge difference in taste!  The staff was friendly and I truly have found my favorite pizza place. Their prices are great too!

Uz1B7T7T9hG9QDgcyA7iZQ.text: This is great East coast italian food! Best one is white pizza with white big sweet ricotta cheese on top & slice is huge! I also love their Tomato Marinera sauce spaghetti with giant tasty meatballs with sausage! everything there is cooked fresh & family business! great energy there too!

X6-ifgwfJIkThVbOAwnoLg.text: Finally decided to try this place few weeks ago and now I'm the duke lol... been going at least twice a week. Pizza by the slice can be difficult to find out here... especially at this quality. Love that it is around the corner from me and on my way home from work.  But wait... didn't even get to the best part... they have sicilian pies! And they sell it by the slice as well. My new favorite sicilian in Vegas... also convenient that I can see the slices from the window as I pull up to see if they have sicilian lol... yes.. i'm that lazy.  Anyway... give this place a shot and support local pizza places! So far everything I have had has been good and very fair priced. The staff is very friendly and the family that owns it recently moved to Vegas from Long Island.   Looking forward to many more sicilian slices... now off to reheat one that's in my fridge :)
