c5K6aq3jeLKPHDG7ucAnaw.text: Small, nondescript mom and pop joint. Super friendly and inviting staff. Excellent, excellent pizza. Cheese is phenomenal. Dough was really good too. Sauce is flavorful, and a great ratio of sauce to cheese. One of the best pizza places my brother and I have ordered from here in Vegas.

TMv2nM1VNoQ2Ttb2_XM-rA.text: Pizza was decent. Customer service wasn't the best there's a small windo with some pizza out no labels  only small paper menu and the second you get to him he points at you I ask is that the pizza for the special he gives me a attitude and I say ok what's what he really doesn't explain I said just give me the lunch special pepperoni for $5 ended up $6.50. I'll return one more time to give them a chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Careful that special isn&#39;t right they didn&#39;t tell me what was $5

VMTx7mtB7JGusOV67cXGWA.text: Followed yelpers advice and found this wonderful restaurant when staying at the JW Marriott.  Walked into the place and knew I was getting an order of garlic knots! They smell and ARE heavenly. We ordered a large meat lovers pizza and it was one of the best pizzas my family has eaten...the oven they use makes the crust amazing, their sauce was perfect. If your anywhere near west Las Vegas you must eat here

RCiNCll5NgPkuxDYJgopmQ.text: The new owners are on to something good with this place.  The wings are tasty with the perfect amount of hotness to the sauce, (we had the medium).  Their regular pizza is great and is the correct size for a large pie, unlike a lot of places out here in Vegas where the large pie is an inch to an inch and a half smaller than it should be diameter-wise. Had a chance to try their "grandma" pizza, which was phenomenal.  It really brought me back to some of the great pizza I enjoy back in Long Island.   The place is family owned and operated and I love supporting local places like this and I would highly recommend you, (the reader of this review), to do the same.

3f6iRQEsi6y0rIvnzsJTdQ.text: These guys are incredible. NEW OWNERS, so have another go at it if you have previously been more than two months ago.   Sometimes, you just need to let the pizza do the talking. Let's try that!  Pizza - "My incredibly tasty crust and fresh toppings are crafted with love by my family that came from Long Island, NY. I'm priced well, and you can have me any way you like. Eat me, now".   That does it for me. It looks, smells, feels, and tastes like an East Coast gem in the middle of the desert. Get here for their lunch specials and come back for the hospitality.

4Y5mpRam2Ee8AfNpJfI3-w.text: I picked the food up and we ate at home. It was still nice and hot upon arrival. We split a pizza, the chicken parm plate and salad.  The pizza wasn't bad at all, but the sauce needed a little extra something. For a True a New Yorker to say pizza is pretty good you know you've got something going for you. The salad was great! You can definitely tell it was made fresh and with care! Every ingredient was delicately sliced and perfectly placed...and the house Italian dressing - WoW! Ok so the chicken parm actually hit home to me because I can truly say it tastes like Grandma used to make! The way it was breaded and fried just reminds me of Sunday dinners as a kid back in Queens. The cheese on top was very good, as well  definitely not a cheaper cheese. The place is so cute inside, too! They had the game playing above a very cozy atmosphere, and everyone was so nice. It all just fit. Don't get this place confused with another spot that has a similar name. I would definitely recommend giving it a try.

y5BZphDMHrtdM-qBOySwpg.text: The Ceasar Salad and Pizza are To Live For.... the Best Caesar salad got it a long time made with fresh baked bread croutons.... with just the right crunch not too hard not too soft just right absolutely the best Caesar salad I've had in awhile The Pizza Slice was so good and authentic...huge slices Quick Lunch menu will fill you up

lwqrpruCEsBJBGNTQmYfmw.text: I finally tried this place out! We got the Mothers Pizza and oh my god it was delicious! I followed another yelpers reviewer advice and added pepperoni and sausage, and I'm happy I did! I picked this order up at 12:30am and couldn't believe it was open till 3am! Now I have a new awesome late night pizza joint right around the corner from me, this is not good news for me lol.   The staff was super friendly and even held the door open while I walked out with my hands full. I will definitely be back!

Ra7bzXFyGMQDJ9CXpEfFlQ.text: Bambino's is a 5 star place!  Portions are great, the Caesar salad and white pizza were delicious, the restaurant and restroom were clean, the service was outstanding! Lisa was very enthusiastic and wonderful. She knew what she was doing and seemed to care and love her job.  We ordered large Caesar salad and white 18 inch pizza. Wow...what a great service and dedication for less than $23.00. Everything was amazing! We are definitely coming back! Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White pizza $21.00
Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large Caesar salad $6.50

v5LHhx1Daafm81Xv4GU-Lw.text: We love Bambino's.  Tonight we ordered a supreme pizza but got a pepperoni.  I called and the gal apologized for the confusion.  Unlike my experience with Napoli pizza who arrgued wth my and told me to leave the wrong pizza outside, she asked if i wanted the right pizza now or another time.  I said tonight please. Not only did our pizza get to us quickly, they also included 2 cannolis!!!!  THAT'S CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!

jYXegkL-fwLaTsC82C6AQA.text: AMAZINGGGG!!!  So damn good.  When I'm craving certain flavors I want exactly that. The herbs on the grandma style pizza, with the warm chewy dough, mixed with their warm delicious marinara sauce, with a thin crunch of the crust. I was in heaven!!! I got Grandma style and the regular slice of cheese pizza. The regular was okay but that grandma slice was the best slice of pizza I've had in a while. I'll definitely be back for it. All under $5... very satisfied!

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AWUt6pY-iSHO7klWtOK5QQ.text: As an Italian who only eats Italian foods (especially pizza) at very certain restaurants, this place is.. well very underwhelming.   The cheese.. not sure if it was the delivery guys fault for taking too long or the way it was made, but you grab a slice of bread and sauce and dive in! The cheese isn't staying on this pizza more than a second.   The flavor was good, wish I would've been able to enjoy the entire slice of pizza though.   It's only a 2 because of the flavor. Probably won't be ordering from here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese.. not staying on the pizza.

HUWKQADr7q1iotgLDOayKg.text: The white pizza here is amazing! The crust is just perfect--crispy on the bottom and chewy on the edges. The cannoli was also pretty good. Of course, nothing out here can compare to Mike's Pastry, but this is definitely the best I've had out side of the East Coast. Ordered for pickup and it was ready on time and correct.

aPZNE6YqoWp4l4fDAvNHuQ.text: What a disappointment , I'm from the east coast and was expecting comfort in the food to remind me of home, everything what's ZERO STARS!!! From the moment we entered the place was a failure, we were not greeted properly, confusing entry you literally don't know what to do. Server wasn't train properly did a horrible job, the food quality was the WORSE ( all food tasted like it was frozen) didn't give appetizers at the same time and one of entree's was late too!!! They took forever to cook while the restaurant pretty much was empty and you can clearly see at least 4 staff members in the kitchen area. Also they had the fan at max which made our food cold in 5 mins. I DON'T RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT!!! OVER PRICED for the quality, I mean I wouldn't even want it FREE. Management needs to put in place a process, no wonder it was empty.  9/4/19

yY2km3Z5tBh9ZYslOxqSNw.text: My favorite pizza place in Las Vegas and Los Angeles combined. Amazing quality pizza,, absolutely amazing! I love their pasta dishes, wings, basically everything. I'm not sure if Bambino's is family owned but judging from amazing customer service and individual approach, I certainly think so. I highly recommend. No other pizza for me, bambino's for life! :)

rDUd4X0eC1148WttYKCIww.text: This was the best pizza place.. there are daily specials as well. The staff is awesome, and the food is great! if you want a good pizza and a great atmosphere.. Go to Bambino's! Thank you guys for dinner!!

9HHNkBrEJaMEbXbk0LAggw.text: This place was amazing. I got the honey garlic wings and traditional buffalo wings and they were delicious. Some of best pizza I've ever had. The service was beyond exceptional. They were super nice and friendly to my five year old. And to top it off the cannolis were off the chart. I couldn't name a negative thing about this place if I tried. I'd give more stars if I could. We will definitely be back again.

NMVD1Q_xHhbZhuHP617H3w.text: Really good sicilian or the Mama's pizza.  I changed the toppings up and added mushrooms and black olives.  The pizza was cooked just right with golden cheese at the edges.  I thoroughly enjoyed the pizza and would have bought more if I hadn't moved.

ZjMzCl3AYfwFw3lb4JyDNQ.text: Easily the best pizza you can get in Vegas. Tastes just as good as some of the places I had in New Jersey. Perfect amount of toppings and cheese, never too burned. Waitress here is always super sweet and treats everyone great. Coming here for dinner is always a joy!

fsjW35s2GL4MHhVjh8FrMg.text: I hadn't been to this location in years. I ordered a pizza and some wings. The food was ready fast and the service was great. The pizza wasn't over the top and neither were the wings but I was still satisfied. The ranch was super watery as well. Not a bad place to grab a quick bite.

VMSEoxalSJo7doANILUnwg.text: My family and I love this place! The staff rules and the pizza is awesome! We go here after my son's hockey practice every other Monday. One of the best pizza spots in Vegas!

D3-WuWtymyTxmla8Y2kZkw.text: I visited here with my brother over lunch. I called before deciding to visit to see if they had a gluten free crust option which they said they did. I just had a Margherita pizza with the gluten free crust and it was delicious. I was really just looking for a decent restaurant in the area between me and where my brother was coming from and decided on this place because it had positive reviews and I was pleasantly surprised by this little place overall. I would recommend to anyone looking for good east coast style pizza. The service was fantastic and we didn't have to wait long for our food. I will likely visit again.

O3fR_leux9fiF3xsh6gmjQ.text: Haven't been here for a couple months, so figured I would drop in , so the first thing is they must have let the young women at the register go. So onto the pizza , nothing out in the rack & the old lady working there now says we have cheese & pepperoni,  which I thought were coming out of the oven  But no this was leftover pizza from the day before for the same full price ; And with no mention of this being leftovers from the day before & it really tastes bad.  Been coming here for a couple years & always thought the pizza was very good  After this waste of money for this garbage I will not be back  Do not eat here , 1. You run the risk of getting  Food poisoning from there day old layovers 2. You will  at the very least get an upset stomach  3. Do you want to pay top price for day old leftovers  4 after getting food poisoning in the past from leftover food , I very much reccomend against eating here

QniNypsRyiiVnvFyXKGJQA.text: After a craving for NYC style pizza slices, a friend recommended Bambino's. A small shop with orange walls, the place was exactly what I'd been looking for!  The pizza slices were super tasty and they have a special where you get 2 slices & a drink pretty darn cheap. The first time I went, I got pepperoni & black olives. The second time, I got just cheese. Both times, the slices were perfect.   It's honestly the closest I've found in Vegas to NYC style slices with tasty crust and good cheese. But it's also nothing special... exactly what I'd expect from a slice shop!   The service has been really nice both times. The decor is NYC themed but again, nothing special.   I recommend it if you're in the market for a good slice!

uzNXwUdUEn8LbBH_smt7GA.text: As an East-coast native myself; i can vouch that this is pretty damn close!  The thin NY style crust mimics any place in NYC you would find on the corner of a busy street. I had the Alla Vodka pizza- I'm not sure if they forgot to put onions/pancetta on it or if the online description meant that those were IN the sauce, but there definitely could have been more of each - that's my only complaint. Delish- would recommend !

IQ86sdsQVx7S-GHfYjecLw.text: Ordered a crispy pizza, picked it up and it was so soggy couldn't pick up the slice not even folding in half.  It was so oily that the oil soaked through the bottom of the box.  When I called them she put the phone down to see what she could do then hung up on me.  Do not go to these rude people

fe-fDG6HuLp-1AXDP743ng.text: Eh, I should have listened to the reviews saying you need more cheese. We ordered a sicilian to go and while it was decent, it 100% needed more cheese. It wasn't as thick as the sicilian pizza I used to get back home, but it was good enough. I'd definiately go back, but I'd get extra cheese this time. Prices and service were good, so no complaints there!

scrBZwDL9eOjv7DlkxVp7A.text: Being a New Yorker for 21 years prior to moving to Vegas, good Pizza is hard to come by. Bambinos which is conveniently located near my place of employment really shined when I went to lunch and had a slice. The pizza crust was crispy and golden, the cheese was stringy and delicious and it produced just the right amount of oil when doing the original NY pizza fold. Of Corse its not exactly NY pizza because this is Las Vegas but its one of the best I have tried here and I am a constant returning customer. You may notice the 4 star rating rather than 5, this is not due to the quality of their food its actually referring to their customer service. How I am treated when I go somewhere is important and adds to the whole dining experience. I have been to Bambinos several times and every time I am there I am not greeted by any employee, the individuals standing behind the counter all look kind of miserable and unhappy and don't seem to really interact with their clientele. That being a little disappointing, it still does not steer me away from that heavenly slice of pizza. It is a must try, just don't be surprised if the employees don't really engage with you. Great food just not one of those old style family pizza places that makes you feel at home.

jilqBJlyluzDdnJtImQloQ.text: So glad we decided to try this restaurant after laser tag!  This was the best pizza I have had in 30 years! I also hail from LI,  The pizza was perfect. Oil dripping, lovely melted cheese and real great toppings. Service was great. We were a group of 9 with 4 boys! Can't wait to come back to visit my daughter so I can have more...unless they would perhaps like to open one in Phoenix!

9Vu3f6AqtD1uKfIaGZ6wWw.text: The best spot in town for a 2 slice special. For $6 I got 2 slice w/topping and a drink too. One thee best mom and pop pizza spots in town. Price is great and quality of food is amazing. Also the garlic knots are boss too. If you guys do try this place out. Don't forget to get a slice of the white pizza. You won't regret a thing at all!

KvHtiyvly8Ak5-6FL3Pd0g.text: More pizza please!!!!!  We went to Bambino's not knowing what to expect and with open minds.  We are pizza lovers and are always looking for the next awesome slice to experience.  What we found was a fun Boston Pizzeria.  This means lots of Red Sox stuff and super yummy thin crust pizza.  It's a great time to be had!  Let me just say, the Meat Lovers pizza from Bambino's blew our minds and we ate THE WHOLE THING in under 10 minutes.  10 minutes!!!!  I don't think we even stopped to take a breath between bites because it was so tasty!  We inhaled the awesome pizza because it was simply amazing.  It had flavorful pepperoni, ham, and some of the best sausage I have ever had, EVER!  We also tried some yummy garlic knots, cheese sticks, chicken fingers (yes, I steal my baby girl's chicken fingers when she isn't looking), and fries. Oh and the zeppoles!  I have never had a zeppole and didn't know what to expect.  They are Italian style donuts and are one of the best things I have ever eaten dessert-wise.  They were hot fried dough, covered in powdered sugar and other fun spices and were finger licking good!  Everything we tried was delicious, came in a huge serving, and at a very good price.  How can you go wrong?  It is a small joint, but it feels super homey.  The staff was always coming out to talk to us and make sure we were happy.  There was a lovely young lady, Stephanie, who was awesome!  I think she was about 13 and was on top of everyone in the restaurant.  She was running the counter and taking food orders, as well as being the welcoming committee.  She would even come out to play with my daughter from time to time, just to make sure she was enjoying lunch too!   It is a great mom & pop place and you feel so welcomed just walking in the door.  I wish Vegas had more places like this one!  Every bite I took in Bambino's was delightful and I will be back for more!

Eo8K9D1h4qv5zWM9BWkqOw.text: Wow horrible. The mozzarella sticks were good, our food had no taste and the chicken was way over cooked.  me my wife and daughter didn't even finish our meals waiter took them away and we didn't get compensated for any part of it.   They seamed more interested in making pizzas for people because those were going in and out all over the place but sitting down for a chicken marsala meal which tasted like it was made with water just stunk I'll never go back    And the wait for dining in the restaurant, we just about left - we waited about 45 min for junk. And the size of their cups for sodas I'm not in kindergarten I want an adult size cup....

3VaVAPErbdP_WrS9sbTQJw.text: The entire pizza experience is determined by what manner you choose to eat your pizza.  A lively topic of conversation ensued on our UYE about proper technique.  Turns out Loren F. and I are the fork and knife users.  Antonio preferred the folded pizza and eating it by hand technique.  Seems the rest of the table preferred the pick it up and eat it without folding it technique.   There's nothing better to go with pizza than good company.  Michele H. was kind enough to prepare a large table for our group complete with appetizers and a little table for the kiddos to work on their coloring projects.  To the pizza itself, I ordered two slices of the vegetarian.  I posted those pictures for your review.  I believe I am correct in that this would be equivalent to four pieces of pizza anywhere else.  I was very happy with the taste of my pizza, the ratio of sauce to veggies was just right and the individual tastes of the vegetables really popped in my mouth.  I couldn't finish my two slices so I ended up sharing it with Loren F. and Skyler and LJ.    As far as the atmosphere goes, it was like a cute side street pizzeria you might expect to find in "Bowston".  I appreciated the themed pictures, jerseys, Red Sox paraphanelia.  I don't get the large Citgo sign next to the drink machine, seems to detract from the rest of the memorabilia.    I did look over at Marie T. dabbing the grease off the pepperoni and cheese.  That was a big negative to me.  From what I have been taught, the better meats and cheeses don't pool grease on the top of the pizza when cooked so that was a negative to me. That's the reason for my rating.  All in all, though I think everyone enjoyed their meal and the fried dough was very popular.  I decided to stay away from the garlic knots, fried dough but did indulge in a few fries.  The service was very attentive and I believe we were all happy about that.  I'd say this is a great place to bring kids or a small group for some thin crust pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh ingredients!
Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These are two slices of veggie pizza

2mZR80Gwuks0Fspp3npXUQ.text: This was my first time eating here. I ordered the 2 slices of pizza and a soda for $5. The service was amazing. I was acknowledged immediately and given a cup for my drink while waiting on my pizza.  I got my 2 slices of pepperoni pizza pretty quickly. It was fresh, hot, and tasted fantastic. The staff immediately asked how my pizza was after my first few bites.   I didn't have any issues with my food, but if I did, I feel very confidently that they would have taken care of my problem right away. They do an excellent job and they make it look very easy.  I will definitely be returning there for lunch in the future.

3oNPLvQYfEoPC-gPf_XsVA.text: Best place for pizza and pasta in Vegas. I've been in town for 14yrs and haven't found a good pizza place .... until now!! And I'm born and raised in NY. Hands down best place. Owner always there working with a great staff.

os2vBTqJqSjRnXxrwDi5Yw.text: Came here for a UYE put together by Michele H. I have to admit this was a little far for me, but I don't mind driving for the good food and even better company. I drove by this place numerous times when I lived on this side of town. Now I regret passing it because I missed out on some delish pizza.   Upon waking in, it's a cute little place with about 10 tables. It's clean and the walls are decorated with numerous sports teams memorabilia. Michele and a few other yelpers already had a few tables put together for the event with some appetizers on the table for us to try. There were fries, mozzerella sticks and garlic knots. We arrived an hour later so they were already cold. I did try the garlic knots. Good buttery garlicky flavor. I imagine these would be fantastic if they were hot and fresh.   I ordered the #1 lunch combo which came with 2 slices of cheese pizza and a drink for $5. It was 50 cents per additional topping so I added pepperoni and garlic. My friend had the #2 lunch combo which came with one slice of cheese pizza, a salad and a drink for $6. He opted for his pizza as Hawaiian which was $1 extra I believe. Our food was delish!! The salad was bright, colorful and fresh. Nice crunch to the lettuce and the Italian dressing was just perfect. The pizza was also delish!!! Thin crust NY style, which I'm not a huge fan of, but this was amazing. My 2 slices of garlic/pepperoni were huge! It was greasy so I had to tab some of it off with a napkin. No biggie. I loved how they chopped up the garlic and spread it throughout the 2 slices instead of huge chunks here and there. And there was plenty of pepperoni on there as well. I'm not a huge fan of Hawaiian but my date said it was yummy. Lisa G. ordered the vegetarian pizza which looked yummy as well. Colorful and packed with veggies. I would have tried it if I wasn't so full.   Towards the end, the owners brought us fried dough covered in butter and powdered sugar. I pretty much ate the entire basket and had to move them away from me. Loren and I did have a mild choking incident when we both inhaled the powdered sugar on accident. Good times. The owners were very friendly and were very easygoing. They made sure everyone was fully stocked and had everything they needed. Great event with awesome food and awesome people. Thanks Michele H!

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni and garlic :)

kMvgyo_rTHlTKs_6YIzRpg.text: I searched the Summerlin area for a great pizza spot and finally stumbled across Bambino's. Very glad I did as their pizza is top notch. Only reason I didn't go 5 stars is that pepperoni is just a tad too greasy. But the meatball pizza was just perfect! Ordered their baked ziti one night when it was just me and that was very tasty as well. Will miss Bambino's when I move from Vegas this month.

U3BPPGzjGGscJJser4S2lQ.text: Great service! ! Best pizza I have had in a long time. Nice thin crust. I'm from back east and this made me feel like I was at home!

Yc4KxxhQgCepiuWl7VQSrg.text: Consistently great food, very friendly staff that makes you feel like family I would recommend this establishment to anyone who wants East Coast style pizza a good environment and friendly service.

pDbY1DMd0XpPQ6YVdV7hgg.text: Awesome staff, great pizza, great prices, very honest with times when backed up.  Great little dine in area too  Have a gluten free crust  Definitely recommend this place

hUFAWbF3DxosFbNDhWLayA.text: For weeks my husband has been telling me we should eat here. He's been before and raved about the place. Tonight, we finally went for dinner with our daughters and it was exactly as he said. Food was awesome. Fresh,  flavorful, authentic! The owner, Ralph, made us feel like we were having dinner in his own home. So welcoming and comfortable. Our server, Nick, was attentive and observant. The place was packed and we never felt rushed. My husband was right about this restaurant! We will be back!

I-2MuT-TIIKBWZbMBIl-cw.text: LOVE LOVE LOVEEEEEE!!! This place is fantastic! As close to a True NY pizza you will find in Vegas... or at least that we have found so far. Quite frankly, for us, there is no reason to keep looking once you take your first bite into one of their slices! We have only tried the pizza so far but boy does the rest of the menu look good too. I cannot wait to try out the stuffed shells! It is so hard to ever drive by here without stopping in! It is worth the 30-45minute (depending on traffic) drive for us!

lrt8p0XbcjdZOhxNcHlb1A.text: I saw this restaurant on a list in the RJ. After reading it was known for East Coast food, I had to go.  Very nice place. Very clean. It is a small place and fills up.  We were greeted as soon as we entered.  Service was excellent.  We ordered two dinners. I ordered the chicken parmigiana. It is the first place that I have been to in Las Vegas, that matches what I always had in NY.  My husband ordered the seafood pescatore. They were kind enough to make it with a garlic and oil sauce for him. It was a large platter of fresh seafood.  The chef asked us how everything was and we could honestly say it was great. After speaking with him a few minutes we learned he is from Long Island, as I am as well. He told us it is all family working there.  We will be return customers!!!

sUhTQXxhluAMPWn4HRDCCg.text: My new favorite pizza in Las Vegas!!!  So glad I found it as I've been searching for a great pizza for years now!!!  Will definitely be back and hope they expand to the Centennial Hills area ASAP!

e34JTxekeAFai0gQmefdDw.text: Best Italian pizza/pasta joint on the west coast- hands down! Amazing spaghetti and meatballs, mozzarella sticks etc. Being from NJ and living Orange County CA and now Las Vegas the struggle has been real finding an authentic Italian owned pizzeria - here it is folks! Family owned! Tomato sauce that is NOT watered down but chunky and authentic. The portions are huge here so come hungry! The price is excellent and overall the family who owns this actually works here and are so helpful and warm! John waited on us today and he was kind and even offered insight on areas of Las Vegas to us! Best pizza and spaghetti and meatballs in Vegas !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs 5/5 ! Enough to feed two! Hearty thick gravy

4E8d5bdccqUiImLu3dHzdg.text: This is easily the best pizza place in vegas. I have been to almost every pizza place. It is not even close. Get the wings bbq style, get the buff chicken wood fire pizza. The shrimp parm sandwich is really good too. Everything here is good, u wont regret it. Im just waiting for another location closer to my house

bxkvwWG6lhvpjGifXp0ZOg.text: I went there a few weeks and got a few slices and it was good!!!  Then went tonight ordered a Hawaiian sub can. Bacon for pepperoni.  Was overcharged and the pizza wasn't that tasty.  And for the price it was small.  Kinda disappointed because I like to support local businesses but don't like being overcharged for food that isn't all that.  May go back one day... .

8WqA1AmKy2NO98BW5dvc-g.text: This place has the best mussels and spaghetti sauce! I could dip the bread forever!!! Thank you so much!!!

4FDUkgpguUpSNgoBc__clw.text: Brought the fam to Vegas. Used Yelp to find one of the best rated pizza joints in the area.  It was definitely good pizza and the staff was unbelievable! These guys are awesome.

wel2YYrEP07vLiwD9RyOlg.text: Awesome lunch specials. the pizza is very yummy but the best thing is their calzone. size portions are huge.

laqH0aDmpT6S8t5-XQ50mQ.text: Best pizza in vegas im sure that term is used often but coming from the east cost this is exactly what you will get if you do go. Great service great food love there Grandma Pizza

0kYwmU3fU4LvzRQCNDyCrQ.text: This place was highly recommended to me for NY Pizza. My wife and I recently went there for lunch. The Pizza was OK but not like the thin crust Pizza in NY. The Pizza was too doughy.

mfEDlj_PjJVBkg6zY9mG8Q.text: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED in the service!! Waited over 2 hours for a delivery when we are only 5 minutes away. Called a few times for an update on the order and no apology given for the delay the response given "we are working on it".  Food was disappointing, cold and soggy fries with a flat tasting soda.

UwvUXeeKMr3qTWmeG_C3tg.text: The pizza was tasty enough and the customer service was adequate. When we came in, the server was sitting at a table doing paperwork and stayed there until we were ready to order. Then she sat back down and did more paperwork until our food was ready. We were the only ones in there, so it was ok, it just didn't seem especially professional. The pizza was good, but it wasn't anything special. It was an ok experience, and I wouldn't turn down another slice of this pizza, but I wouldn't suggest it or go out of my way to get some more.

CaP2nV8CsD1F0wSWrPOQXw.text: Came here for a UYE.  If you took the boston memorabilia down, this place would rock.  The pizza reminds me of my east coast youth and they rock with Faygo Rock and Rye and Red Pop.  They make beignets and let you put your own powdered sugar on yourself.  A small kid table in the corner.  The staff is friendly and the pizza is reasonably priced.  I wish it was a little larger and the seating more comfortable.

dvjhB9FJsDaTC_d9z19KxQ.text: Good deal.  Large pizza and 10 wings.  $18.00. The pizza is good.  They came and gave us two slices of Grandma Pizza as a sample. The crust was really delicious on those slices.  I will order that type of pie next time.  This place shows promise.  I know they are re-naming it soon.

DLu8FOWY-U7hGhVO50tWZw.text: This place is a cute homely place but when Jamie G and I planned this event he didn't tell me about it being a Boston place. How do you take a yankees girl and put her in a boston place? lol.....but I guess it would be a good place for watching a big boston game.......The place isn't that big but we put some tables together and it was good for us.  The pizza is a good balance of thin crust, sauce and cheese.  It was a good pizza where folding was perfect.  They gave us cheese sticks, garlic knots and fries before the food came. The cheese sticks were a big hit with my daughter who usually won't eat much.  The zeppoli's were also a hit as she loved them and they are small enough you can have more than one.  The powdered sugar that covered them was an added bonus for her! lol....... the cannolis were really good with the perfect balance as well.  I got them to go and they were smart and put cream underneath so they wouldn't move in the container.   The service was good as they were attentive throughout.  Overall the pizza was a hit and as observed by the hawaiian pizza next to me, the crust was able to handle toppings well without getting soggy.  If I was in the area I would stop by again for some to take home.

tUtcKUxa1l5_Si-r9uPhvQ.text: I am updating to add that the calzones here are great.  We tried them for the first time a couple months ago, and now we have switched and regularly order calzones instead of pizza from here.  They are huge!  Also, it's not on the menu, but they will make a calzone with any topping you want, if you don't want the ones that are listed on the menu.

nkHeiHDNcy-h7yrN7W_6rw.text: I wanted to wait to write a review after the 2nd time I went because the first time was so good I thought I was over reacting. I just ate there for lunch though and I know I'm not. Since CGs has closed down this is absolutely the best pizza spot in town. If you are in a hurry they can heat up 2 slices for you fast! Stop by if you want the best pizza in town!!!

LSmjPLDnAYdgu4GnEODnfQ.text: They are new owners from back east, the menu has changed.  They have added alot of new items on the menu.  It is the real deal Authentic New York Style Pizza.  I have tried quite a few items and enjoyed all of them. They sell pizza by the slice, sicilian and grandma pizza by the slice.  They also have woodfired pizza, calzones, rice balls, pinwheels just to name a few. Tonight I ordered a pizza with grilled chicken, roasted peppers, plum tomatoes, roasted garlic, fresh mozzarella it was awesome.  You have to try this place, you will not be disappointed, trust me i know NY pizza, i was born and raised in NY.

12zeIv1a20oADXEXD0QAVg.text: Bambinos pizza is excellent.... We usually stick with the same sausage and pepperoni not real greasy staff is very pleasant and it's always nice when you're supporting folks from Long Island!

hpEiNkMaEjdykZ5pBv0kOw.text: I'm just curious if I owned a pizza establishment and didn't offer chicken fingers or even wings with a pizza combination special some places offer fingers and Pizza and other places offer wings and pizza specials but the thing that gets me the most as in this industry of pizza fingers and wings which is the basic reason why most people call a pizza company for delivery on a weekend or special occasion or just want to eat something is for these 3 main items so if they can't find a distributor that can offer a fair price to them so they in turn can offer a good price to consumer which is us the specials what does it say about the establishment are they overcharging us in order to make an extra buck does the money mean more to them than their name a lot of questions come to mind I've always tried to do what's best for the people who spend the money but in Las Vegas is so hard to find a business expecially and pizza a company with good customer service great product an amazing specials it's almost like you get two of the three why can't we find a pizza company that offers 3 of 3 that being said I've called around I've even ordered and give him the benefit of the doubt and I have not been impressed yet not saying I have expectations what just looking for a reasonable price I understand the companies make a profit but when they do charge more than $50 to get a pizza and fingers or wings depending on what special the offer to me is ridiculous so I always let the company know I found them on Yelp I always let the person on the phone now please take care of me and I don't mind taking care of you but for some reason its extremely hard to find somebody who even cares that matter and maybe the management or owners talk to their employees before they hire are more screen them we are here for the customer and we want to give them the best experience possible instead of only offer this weight off of that call somebody else so is it better to make more money now then way more money later thank you Yelpers

AObSBEqaDoZe8XqhR3SPUg.text: We went there because the newspaper article said the owners were from Italy, the pizza was brick oven cooked and sauce was amazing.  Well, it was just an average pizza!  Grimaldi's is still number one in our book, and frankly Marco's pizza is better.  Disappointed.

qFLxKsFpJJlCMx_Zz1hKCg.text: ordered pizza bianca and bbq chicken for 1st time at bambinos,if anyone can say anything these pies melt in your mouth and have incredible flavors of garlic,olive oil basil,bbq with bacon and onion and knots so soft and fluffy abd full of garlic and john fantastic service from him a must try

aOWh3ZbDJb5IEwoBM6sQWg.text: What can I say?! I LOVE THIS PLACE!! The pizza... killer!! The crust is PERFECT! It's chewy with just enough crisp. The sauce... I could (maybe I do, don't judge me) drink it straight!!! They use quality cheese, they take it out of that big brick oven and you can't even wait for it to cool down. I happily live with blisters on the roof of my mouth for this pie!! I pick it up to-go and shamelessly eat a slice before I even make it home! Their garlic knots are little bits of heaven when you dip, no no no, when you DUNK them into their house sauce, which I will admit, I do actually drink it straight from the cup. I have faith in humanity when I eat those things. Everything these guys make is spot on, and I just can't get enough!! Not to mention, every single one who works there, I want to be best friends with. Or at least they make me feel like I already am the moment I walk through the door. I love these guys! I will forever be faithful to Bambino's and YOU SHOULD BE TOO!! (Believe it or not I was always a girl who swore she "wasn't a pizza girl." PSHH has that changed! THANKS BAMBINO'S)

u7upg4---1vekNC4YdHn1w.text: I'm originally from Boston. I have live in Vegas for 3 years... looking everywhere for a decent pizza. I've finally found it and it is 5 mins from where I live. I get it to go. I always order a large cheese pizza. Before I leave I put the red pepper flakes and the parm that they have on the table. It's a good pizza.

lFJpieead5ydOGHVocrbFg.text: The vegetarian pizza was one of the worst pizzas I have ever had. Only a thin crust from Dominos was worse. The positive reviews here are fake.   I lived in Connecticut for 28 years and know exactly what a thin crust pizza is supposed to look and taste like...Bambino's is not even close.   The pie was grossly overloaded with ingredients and was soggy. Getting the pizza took over half an hour and there were no other customers in the place.   There was nothing good about the pizza.

nssLvGqwhWRKKVrHnH34UQ.text: Very close to NY style pizza but not enough cheese. Fresh ingredients and great crust too.  For Vegas its very good for sure :).

tm1bSb0MKxmLoIIGpXpDkQ.text: Authentic NY pizza. Good dough, sauce is not too sweet-- just right! The garlic knots are fabulous. Nice, clean bathroom. Really great service from Rosie. Overall, a nice place for a meal. I'd come back!

0q54j41cwKfA-ICvDvJdFA.text: The slice soda special here is great! The staff is friendly a helpful. This place is real deal Italian according to the older Italian lady here at the same time.

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iEfv7lxUD6BoF2a_VYZHYA.text: Tried out Bambinos for the first time and I can now say it is one of my favorite pizza joints in Vegas. Not only is the food amazing, but the service is great they truly add a personal touch. We ordered pizza, pasta, wings and cannolis, service was prompt and food was amazing 10/10. They've definitely gained a new regular! I recommend trying this place out!

P6nq8sD_SdeZONINmEOPLA.text: Why is it so hard to find pizzerias that will sell by the slice?!  A small, simple place covered in Boston memorabilia and staffed by friendly folks churns out the largest foldable $2.14-a-slice cheese pizza I've seen in a while.  And, bonus? It's delish. Top with a shake or ten of the oregano and red pepper at the table, tear in, and enjoy!  Or take it to go: they have the perfect small boxes to take your single simple slice home to eat in the comforting blue glow of your television.

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giant ny cheese slice

B7Qu3FT4LLtkZsShEcDnyw.text: We eat here all the time! Family owed and operated. Everything is delicious and they make ingredients in house. The cannolis are amazing!!!! If pizza is an option then this place should be the top of the list. The place is closed on Monday. The lunch deal is so good $5 for a slice and a drink! Can't beat it! A great quaint place for a relaxed date or family dinner.

64nhNN2tsj_Y9P3cG5hB9g.text: I am a new transplant to Vegas. Since my move here in November, in the Summerlin/Spring Valley area, I have NOT found a pizza place that was actually good. This sentiment is shared by my husband who is from New York. And I'm not much of a food snob, pizza generally makes me happy. But....i had yet to eat pizza that has enough crunch throughout the crust, good sauce, and lots of oily cheese. Many pizzas I have tried have a tinny taste or used frozen ingredients bc i could taste the freezer burn flavor. I just have not yet found "good" pizza in Vegas that is reasonably priced. That is, until I visited Bambino's on Saturday 3/11/17. I searched "Pizza Restaurants" here on Yelp and the reviews by New Yorkers, lured me in. It's a small hole in the wall pizza shop. They have a variety of pizzas. We had the Meat Lovers & Pizza Bianca. At first bite of the Meat Lovers pizza, i immediately noticed how good the sauce  was. Usually,  pizza sauce doesn't do anything for me. But the fact that I did get impressed by pizza sauce alone,  meant something. The dough was thin and crispy. There was so much cheese that it was separating from the crust and toppings were sliding off when i folded the slice in half. This pizza was EXACTLY what I have been searching for in Las Vegas. The crust had the perfect burn marks (not blackened,  but brown and toasty) which tasted amazing!!!!  The Bianca was delicious too, with pure garlic, mozzarella cheese and Ricotta balls. I am so happy that the Yelp community pointed me here. This is now our designated pizza shop. They don't offer delivery yet- they are working on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2wyxCLXg_7h15-ZuyQomzg.text: My family and I were in the mood for some good tasty pizza this evening. I was using Yelp to find a good pizza spot around our area and came across Bamabino's East Coast Pizza I mostly read good reviews so I took a chance and ordered their 18" Supreme Pizza for us. So glad that I did. My family and I were very pleased and satisfied with our pizza.  It was very well prepared and cooked. Not to mention they have great staff they were very friendly over the phone and when I walked in to pick it up! Thank you guys! I highly recommend this place! Will be my go-to pizza spot!

EoOc29jdGetqafYv0EXB1w.text: I'm Italian & was raised in NY. All I have wanted for the last 18 years is a slice of NY pizza.  A few place come almost close but not like Bambinos. This is NY Pizza. It is PERFECT. Thin, sauce is yummy & not stingy with cheese.   Just waking in the door is a happy experience. The smell, the NY accent & then the longest 2 minutes of your life waiting for your slice to come out of the oven. OMG I died a thousand deaths waiting for that first slice. It was perfect. Exactly what I had been missing for all these years. Felt like I was back home. Later that evening had to order a pie for the family. This is now a weekly event.   Oh and the other food is great too but I only want pizza. The hot sandwiches are stuffed full, the grandma pie is outrageously good as are the garlic knots.  The guys are great, personable & funny. The shop is spotlessly clean. Did I mention how yummy the smell is? And how the pizza somehow can transport you to your happy place..  Just go there now & get a slice. I guarantee you will be buying a pie & more before the end of the day.

DtnBsl5rc7B3yJzGdYHvPQ.text: I'm not from NY or Italian, BUT I was told that this is authentic NY Italian food by New York Italian herself. She recommended that we come here and raved on and on about the food. So we came. We ate. We conquered.  This family-owned joint is cozy on the inside with friendly staff bustling about. Small tables are dressed with checkered tablecloths. Menu items consist of pizza, pasta, subs and other Italian favorites. I had the spaghetti alfredo ($11) and added two meatballs for an additional $3. My other half got a large all meat pizza with extra cheese. It didn't take long for the food to come out and everything was piping hot. The alfredo was good, but not the best I've had. I wished I had gotten something with marinara. The owner actually brought us a little bowl of it so we could taste it and DAMN it was good. I kicked myself even harder having not ordered it. But that just means I have to return. I appreciated the friendly staff who checked on us often and made us feel welcome. We plan on coming back here ASAP!

eyF8QNTUxvlph5LzYFVwlQ.text: Holy cow, this place was great! Had dinner here: - Complimentary bread and garlic sticks. Perfectly warm, crusty on the outside, soft on the inside. Yum. Side salads with ranch and blue cheese dressings on the side. Are you kidding me?? These humoungous salads were SIDE salads! Wow, they were great, with green and black olives. - 14" Supreme pizza. It's a combo, and really good. Nice chewy crust. Good toppings too. - Cannoli - nice small size, delicious.  So, so good. Will be back!

Photo of Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Supreme pizza 14&#34;

5M1IZHYBqrBE8l9SwZ3LfQ.text: By far, the best pizza place in town. Great food, great atmosphere, great service and great chefs. A very cozy place to come eat and they have more than just pizza.

27vwH9aNDpDSm4EA98i1vA.text: Ladies and gentlemen, if you will please roll up your sleeves because it's about to get messy up in here.   Been to NY three times and NJ once and this pizza tastes as close as I've found to east coast pizza  We've been looking for a place to replace our love of grazianos... Which closed but this place won't do it. It's in a delicious category of its own.   The wings were great. Crispy and tender, not too much sauce. Good sized ranch came with it too. Not skimpy. Fries were limp, almost soggy which were still good but a little disappointing. Good sized but it should be for three bucks. Pizza was large and good, True east coast pizza here, the type that's thing crusted, extra cheesy, flimsy, fold in half, greasy goodness.  Love that they cook the pizza in brick ovens. They just taste different. Impressed she said it would be delivered in 45 to 60 mins and it actually came in 35. Awesome!

Z7qfSTRGKD5_FF4a6y2u-Q.text: Really nice tasty pizza. Had the margarita one. Delicious. My husband went crazy with the spaghetti with marinated pizza. Can't wait to go again. Also really friendly staff. They care about food quality.

CzOLHDRyGKGmFtXeexyckg.text: I've worked at the cleaners in the same lot for over a year and a half and in that time I've gone to Bambinos numerous times. Their food is absolutely amazing, the service is perfect and friendly, and it's not too much to get authentic NY style pizza.  Maximum time I've had to wait for a pizza was 45 minutes and that was due to it being Friday afternoon during the lunch rush. Most of the time I wait 25-30 minutes max and its always fresh, hot, and tastes amazing.  I can't stop raving about this place to anyone looking for good NY style pizza.

FlPEeHp_kwVq7168qv6oCg.text: Pretty decent and obviously ordering a whole pizza trumps the single slice option, which I wasn't as big a fan of. The cheese was tasty and the crust was very good, but maybe not as much sauce as I prefer. A solid option if you're in the neighborhood.

-MC-445w4DIuLm9vw2kPtA.text: The pizza is good the meatball subs are good and the service is very friendly if you need more than that you probably won't find it. Good food and good service equals 5 stars.

Oc8xlMJGHRmrQ226ooJdHQ.text: Really enjoyed my slice of cheese and Sicilian. Will definitely be back. Looking forward to trying some of the dinners.

dEHxbVTb26IIrdls6wxxPQ.text: I love love love this place!!!! I've been here a few times and every time I have had a great experience. Not only is the food fantastic, but the service is excellent!!! My sever tonight was Monica, and I was thoroughly impressed with her customer service!! And if she didn't tell me, I never would have known it was her first day!! She was AWESOME!!! I will definitely be back!!

b2dUFLLi9755E06MFLpbhA.text: Visit on 12/18/16:  I'm not an Italian from New York, or Italian at all for that matter. However, the owners and employees are, and one of the diners that we talked to is yet another New York Italian, complete with the accent. He said that while there are many pizzerias around the city, this is the best and closest to New York-style pizza and serves food that tastes like it came from Little Italy. We also asked him about his dish, which was custom-made. So it seems they will customize dishes for the regulars.  That was his experience, or more like one of many. Ours started with an order of garlic knots and ended with a huge heaping plate of Bolognese spaghetti.  Garlic knots: fluffy, chewy, definitely not anorexic in size, and bursting with butter and garlic bits. Yes, if they claim to be garlic knots, shouldn't they have garlic? Yes, well, I've had the cheap kind at other places that have just some garlic powder baked into them. They come in a small and large order, but I recommend that you get a large order and take home whatever you can't finish. It's that good.  Bolognese spaghetti: house-made sauce with huge portions. My boyfriend and I had trouble finishing a large order. It is big enough for you to share with a friend or possibly two, depending on how much you eat. If you are a teenage boy, you can probably eat a whole order yourself and still have room for a large order of garlic knots and cannolli.  Prices are very good. They are about the same as casual Italian on the Strip, however, the portion size is HUGE and a lot bigger than what you'll get elsewhere. Very good deal. Service was prompt and friendly. Plus it was nice to hear the customers and employees talking to each other about the weather in New York and about cars. Nice ambience.  Yes, it's quite a ways off the Strip, but well worth it. Get over there already!

DlAjS0FPTsQfsn1PoGmIUA.text: This was the best pizza place Ive ever been to. I couldnt help but notice the lovely family atmosphere as soon as I walked in. The food was on another level...very tasty and fresh.  The owner tonya was so friendly and helpful. Cant wait to come back every week.

OqYhFnWcRhm2EQWTv4sIzw.text: My dad was raised in Brooklyn, NY and is super obsessed with pizza - esp finding a good pizza place in the desert.   He finally found this little gem through a recommendation and took me here to give their pizza a try. We usually buy whole pizzas, however, we stopped here for lunch and decided to go with slices instead.   Bambino's has an everyday lunch special: 2 slices + a pop for $5.00 - AWESOME!  We both chose their pepperoni pizza - SUPER YUMMY! The cheese was tasty, had just the right amount of grease on top, and plenty of meat on top. The crust was decent as well, ate the whole thing :)  The restaurant is very small and I'd imagine during the weekend evenings it gets pretty packed.

PtgnKJf1-_JBgs32JfV5Nw.text: We had a large pepperoni pizza with buffalo wings.  It was AMAZING.  The server was beyond nice and checked on us and filled our drinks frequently.  Their ranch is homemade and delicious.  I would recommend this place a million times.  We had enough pizza for leftovers the following night.  I will definitely be going back!!!!

MA8cuoBSrTs3jWzIMPMw_w.text: Great local joint that was busting with energy. All the employees were very friendly!  My wife had the chicken franchaise which she said was very delicious.  It was a full 2 pieces of chicken.    I had the grandma pizza add sausage and pepperoni.  The sauce was amazing and toppings were generous.    Love local places like this where you can tell they take personal pride in what is served.  Will definitely return

2mQ1ai9nLTisngNVwld5rQ.text: Mediocre food at a high price. We ordered Pizza Ala Vodka for $21. The menu reads "Creamy Vodka sauce, mozzarella, onions, prosciutto, and a touch of basil." What we were served was a cheese pizza with pink sauce. I asked where the toppings were and was told they were blended in the Vodka sauce. Don't bother dining in, the place is tiny and several tables are used as restaurant storage. They have cans of soda, no beer, wine, or fountain drinks. I'm not sure what the appeal is, but after one visit, I won't be back.

FZXBKL_lkt_b_udjWlBTLg.text: Garlic knots.   Just ordered a delicious pizza after shopping and a bag of garlic knots.  The knots are ridiculously delicious.  Melt in your mouth.  And garlic garlicky.  A side of sauces and I'm all set.  The pizza is right out of New York.  Very few places in Vegas can compare to the quality of the crust.  Not to thick and not soggy thin or cracked thin.  Just the right texture.  Also the quality of the ingredients is high. The cheese is delicious.  I'd give them a ten I I could   Oh...and the staff is really super friendly.

D-bV_xaI_RSOSYHAYk-hgg.text: This is the epitome of what a Neighbourhood pizza spot should be.  Priced neighborhood not flashy pizza is great tasting and straight to the taste buds. Real New Yorkers. As soon as you step to the register you see Mike making pizza doing everything the way it should be crafting the order like a artist painting a picture.  Staff is great and if you come more than once they know who you are and what you want.

Jlqaq3WYD3e7dv0np5l9_Q.text: Great good old fashioned pizza. Does not disappoint when you're in the mood for pizza made the classic way. Priced just right and sizes are just big enough. Usually we order the 18" pep with mushrooms and it feeds us just fine. Definitely recommend for your next pizza night.

HSNcOvUREZkZtPI1FfLrWw.text: this is the most amazing pizza in all of vegas no one should ever miss this pizza omg i left and fell asleep in the car. i will be here everyday. lets not forget about dessert omg the zeppolis are to die for get them with caramel sauce

FNUtdUhOAU97Acq2PYQrUA.text: Bambinos is a great place. I love pizza and have been in Las Vegas for a year. I just found out about Bambinos and am very happy. It's a family friendly establishment with a great vibe. Come to Bambinos.

BW7yniI41kuV1h1FWWPTyg.text: New York style pizzeria?  Oh my!  Cesar Q. and I were out and about getting errands done and decided to make a stop by this great pizza place.    First off we have ordered take out from here one time before and loved the meatball calzone and chicken parm sub.  Today we actually came in and sat down for one of their lunch specials.  Normally we do all our takeout from 2 places close to home.  Villa Pizza being one of them.  This place has great food and great service!  While Villa tastes good their service leaves a lot to be desired (in my opinion).  We arrived just as they were opening and received a welcome hello from the guy behind the counter.  We ordered my personal favorite of Chicken Francese.  It's served with a beverage, garlic knots and a side of pasta all for $9.  Not to shabby considering how much food you get.  Everything tasted great and exactly as one would expect.  They offer fresh parmesan cheese, none of that stuff in packets.  There is a soda fountain so you can refill your glass as often as you like.    The location is just off Durango and Sahara close to the 7-11 and next to the Subway.  This place has food that tastes as though grandma was in the kitchen cooking it herself!  So happy we found a new Italian spot that has friendly EFFICIENTLY staff and reasonably priced  delivery too!

2PXIHEHkJF3xTsflUsyDjA.text: Ive walked by this place a million times, finally decided to get a pizza because not much was open at 1am. I ordered the gourmet pepperoni pizza. Delicious!

aTTvdzbK-kbEQIbs50L7AA.text: I ordered for delivery and i knew it was going to take a while since they said they were pretty busy so I didn't mind. s4CAi38JY_TwO-poVo_mug.text: This is the best pizza in the western part of the country!!  NY style food,  excellent!  Love love love it.  This pizza is straight out of NY!!

DJ1ioYIUiiS8GlagQNRlIA.text: I love this pizzeria. Hands down has great customer service and there pizza is amazing along with many of their other dishes.

pPxU6qT8_TrfxV9xWpy7kA.text: I used to love this place before the new changes   way too many onions in my salad and loved the fact that they used white American cheese now its just so so ...meh if its not broken don't fix it

6a--AWEV3LD-vjcxsR71hA.text: My son's and I ordered Pizza, Spaghetti & a Chicken Ceasars Salad. Everything was absolutely delicious! Serving sizes are very generous. Highly recommended.

Vh3H3EjEGI5R8euGBgSeNw.text: Hands down, BEST PIZZA IN VEGAS. Call your order in or expect to wait because it takes a while. It's absolutely worth the wait. The grandma's pizza and a la vodka pizzas are to die for. I love the eggplant rollatini, best I've had outside of New York. My husband is from New York and we both agree that Bambino's makes the best cannoli we have ever had.

51G5ZecRSxhK2feoFvALlg.text: Best NY pizza in Vegas. I was born and raised on Long Island, and this is the closest thing to home I've found out here. A must try!!

cJGaEO2qikAwf5BpPLNvfw.text: Bambino has become our goto pizza restaurant because they have one of the best pizzas in town. The crust here is the best, light and crunchy. The service is very friendly, great place to eat or take away. I wouldn't mind driving to get pizzas or other Italian dishes from here even though there are so many other options around where we live. How can you beat their special of large pizza n 10 wings for less than $20.

KXueATqfnwK2n0jRs7pF6g.text: We have been driving past this place for 5 years now and finally decided to get take out after a friend suggested it. Being from NJ we are super picky about our pizza and we were really impressed. It tasted really close to back home pizza. We will now eat at 2 places in Vegas for pizza; Roccos and Bambinos! The wings weren't spectacular but the calzone and canolis were excellent and the staff was so friendly. An employee even helped me to my car. Give this place a try! Reasonable prices too!

HbonnDfExV9EEFE7ZWvGqg.text: Sad. They are no longer. New Yorkers bought it and it will be NY pizza. Looking forward to trying their product.

f-JIIZWUKXy5ukMO6r2DgQ.text: I come here once a week. Food is great and the environment is great. Feels like your back in New York when you are in there. I recommend this place to all my friends and they come out loving it also.

Xd79WSYrzrYCaxgTfbVFnA.text: I have been coming to Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria for a while and I have to say, the staff and food are excellent. Keep up the great work guys

jJA6U4X6P3oDlgX7Vd-6PA.text: It was good, wings were a little salty if they weren't so salty I would've gave it another star. Pizza was bomb I will probably go back got the pizza again

3QGSHtKEWM5B0jJOCoQTrw.text: Really good pizza and pasta. I usually go for the great lunch specials and my favorites are the NY slices (actual Long Island guys running the place) and the penne a la vodka. John is a really nice guy who makes sure you feel welcomed. I'll surely continue to return.

B_T3s7vzZqL-SyZfe1GhYQ.text: Discovered Bambinos a couple of months ago from my sister. She got me a stromboli that had chicken, eggplant, roasted red peppers, and mozzarella. It was incredibly delicious!  Then another time she had me try baked ziti siciliano....really ggod. I wanted to eat more but I decided that I wanted to save it so I could enjoy it again. Tonight I had a stromboli again, and my boyfriend had a Sicilian meat lover's pizza. The pizza was so crispy. It's a family run business and they are very friendly. Also, I highly recommend trying their cannolis.

ifM8TFgTjKcthU_a1NRNEA.text: Pizza is delicious!!!! Service was great and fast!!! Nice restaurant!!! I loved my entire experience!!!

8pImcXohWDhtgDT6om1Qow.text: My theory is when you order the pizza from this place they call new York, have them make a pizza there, box it up and ship it to Las Vegas with UPS At which point you have already left cause your order took too long  right? Wrong! At the point it's delivered to vegas you've already left so  there's a time machine at the back of the store. They travel back in time at the moment you placed your order and BAM! authentic east coast pizza... how else could it taste so good?

foU_xJ8fhY2speaJJY0Uuw.text: Ohhhhhhhh yahhhh!!!!!! Finally some good east coast style pizza and its family owned.  There is some pride and love put into their pizzas. Great flavors and fresh ingredients.  Even as busy as they were they took the time to explain their pizza style.  I always appreciate good customer service so it's awesome to also get great food with that. Will be back next week to try some more off the menu. Highly recommend the white sauce pizza. Look forward to the wood fire style next.

IzL9n2g3I3EF0klXCYyH_Q.text: This pizza needs a lot of improvement. The crust is a bit on the soggy side and the sauce is tasteless. In addition, turn your ovens up so the pepperoni gets cooked to a point of changing state (as in some pepperonis cupping/crusting). I really want this place to succeed as I do not like going to the chains but they need to step it up. Let's improve the sauce, put more of it on the pizza, cook the pizza at a higher temp and find a way so the crust is not soggy.

qHCw-22joXJonn4RfDJLZQ.text: Skimpy topping Not well distributed, so half your slice has no topping  Makes a lot of mistakes Took an hour for the last 2 deliveries  And the staff isn't very nice.   I'm DONE with them!

X07Cn7wI25kd0XvMOCNxtQ.text: Love this place. Have a request? Just ask them. Authentic NY Italian. I've been here every week now since the first time a couple months ago.  Great value for lunch or dinner.  Family owned and operated.
